We ordered one of their Sushi Platters to start that had a variety of sashimi fish on top that was all fresh, firm texture and tasty, their Tempura Prawns were really big prawn pieces and came with a lovely deep fried tempura batter, the Agadashi Tofu came as expected with a creamy soft tofu texture and the last Tobiko fresh fish small roe dish was crunchy and tasty. All in all, 10 out of 10. Weâ€™ll return for a repeat before we leave town in two days!!

Excellent delicious and fresh food, and good service too. The restaurant is down a little alley off the main road, with both and inside and outside space. We had tempura prawns, edamame beans, a sushi platter and udon beef noodle soup. Some of the best food we have had in Vietnam!
Our family of 4 had a delicious meal. The sushi was incredibly fresh, and the Teriyaki Salmon was perfecty cooked. We would absolutely go again!

name: COCOCLUB RESTAURANT BRASSERIE CAFE
address: 53 Ham Nghi street LE DOMAINE DE COCODO Resort, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: The restaurant COCOCLUB is an oasis in the center of Hue, the imperial city of Vietnam . The food is authentic VIETNAMESE FUSION using all Vietnamese and Mediterranean herbs . Our specilialites are unique in HUE and this oasis is locates in a RESORT APARTMENT HOTEL ... LE DOMAINE DE COCODO .
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: This restaurant is not in the touristy area, but is definitely worth the 20 min walk or 5 minute taxi ride. We were attracted by the diversity of cuisines; French, Vietnamese, Italian, plus the great reviews. We met the charming owner, Jennes, who is ethnically Vietnamese but was raised and lived in France. The menu is enormous- 50 pages and is as thick as a book. But Jennes guided us to selections that he had the materials for that day and that he thought we would enjoy. We had French cuisine; lamb and chicken dishes with fabulous sauces and side dishes. A huge and delicious Mediterranean salad started the meal with a Chilean Sav Blanc, and Creme Brûlée and Grand Marnier snifters finished it. While expensive compared to the typical Vietnamese meal, it was only $60 USD. I would guess a $200 meal in the US. The location seems dodgy; it’s definitely not in a neighborhood that is touristy. Our GPS told us to walk down some railroad tracks. Just take a taxi. The setting and ambiance is wonderful; open, outside in a large courtyard with quiet seating areas, a pool, great lighting, nice table sets, beautiful bar. It also is a hotel with rooms that look quite inviting. Highly recommend if you’re ready for great options that include fine non-Vietnamese food. I’m sure that the Vietnamese food is great as well - the chef and kitchen clearly know what they are doing. Service was excellent, but hard to really know as there was only one large party of 20, then us. Jennes is charming if you get a chance to meet him. Fun to hear a Vietnamese man with a French accent.

We discovered this restaurant for lunch quite be accident, and so glad we did. It's hidden away in a quiet area with a hotel and huge pool. The menu is large and both Vietnamese and western food. So many great choices. Our lunches were wonderful. Service was great. We plan to go back for a dinner.

We stumbled across this restaurant and will forever be glad that we did. The owner was incredibly friendly, the menu extensive and there was a lovely atmosphere. I saw on the menu before we visited that they offered gluten free pizza and couldn’t believe my eyes! I have yet to find a restaurant serving gluten free pizza in Hanoi. The gluten free base was crispy but not hard. The pizza was HUGE and the cheese plentiful. I didn’t enquire about cooking methods and cross contamination, but didn’t have a reaction which is fantastic. We would highly recommend this restaurant, particularly if you are a member of the gluten free/celiac club.

name: Duyen Anh Seafood Restaurant
address: Nha Hang Duyen Anh, Hue Vietnam
description: It is a very nice place to eat, good fish and sea food. Very recommended!!! It's a mist in the zone. Meat is also available , salads and very good sticky rice
example_reviews: It is a very nice place to eat, good fish and sea food. Very recommended!!! It's a mist in the zone. Meat is also available , salads and very good sticky rice
We visited here whilst working in Hue, it was recommended by a colleague. It’s a little out of the way but taxis are reasonable we’ll worth a visit

This is a very stylish and huge restaurant, very famous in the area for seafood. We had a wonderful evening with family and friends, absolutely fantastic for special occasions. Really good seafood, well presented.

name: An Phu Garden Restaurant Hue
address: 11 Nguyễn Thái Học Str, Phú Hội Ward, Huế City, Việt Nam, Hue 0234 Vietnam
description: Located in the city of Hue, Vietnam, An Phu Garden Restaurant is a must-visit destination for anyone seeking an authentic Vietnamese dining experience. The restaurant’s reputation for serving delicious local specialties, particularly from the Hue region, has made it a popular choice among locals and tourists alike. An Phu GardenRestaurant offers a cozy and welcoming atmosphere that is further enhanced by the traditional Vietnamese decor. Whether you’re looking to indulge in classic dishes like Banh Khoai , Banh Beo and Bun Bo Hue or simply want to explore the flavors of Vietnam, our Restaurant is the perfect place to savor the rich and diverse culinary culture of this enchanting country.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: We were two in the restaurant today on the recommendation of our guide and the recommendation has been confirmed 100%. Although we only consumed one small thing, we additionally received a fruit plate.The food was extremely good and very nicely decorated. The service was extremely friendly and accommodating and the prices were very reasonable.

First the restaurant setting is exquisite. Beautifully carved wood, inlaid with mother of pearl in the old Vietnamese/ Chinese style. The squash soup with ice cream was rich and luxurious. The presentation of each dish made for a fun meal and the wish you didn’t need to destroy the creations. Finally the service was personal, warm and friendly. If you are in Hue put this gem on your must go list!

Wow! Not only is the restaurant itself the previous home of a royal family, the food is fantastic. The depth of flavor is beyond typical vietnamese fair from much of the country. The food was fresh and beautifully sculptured with attractive vegetables as ducks and dragons. This is a MUST visit in Hue.

name: Com Chay Duong Sinh Lien Hoa
address: 03 Le Quy Don Phu Nhuan, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Google translate was no help at all here! Fried cauliflower was broccoli in sauce, and that was just the beginning. Nevertheless, we pointed and ordered, and what we got was tasty and of course vegetarian, which meant The Vegetarian was able to eat like a true local without fear! Not geared towards tourists, for us this was its charm. Enjoy the adventure!
example_reviews: Google translate was no help at all here! Fried cauliflower was broccoli in sauce, and that was just the beginning. Nevertheless, we pointed and ordered, and what we got was tasty and of course vegetarian, which meant The Vegetarian was able to eat like a true local without fear! Not geared towards tourists, for us this was its charm. Enjoy the adventure!

We did not know where to start from when we wanted to order. We were recommended a set lunch and took it. We did not like the jackfruit, which in fact did not look like jackfruit to us. We liked the "rice paste with green bean filling wrapped", turned out to be something like the "chee chrong fun" we have in Singapore. Delicious. The spring rolls were good. They only have fried ones. Aloe Vera drink must have. We communicated via google translator and the staff was very patient.

This place serves up delicious and cheap vegan food in a lovely setting. The menu translations range from quirky (cauliflower turned out to be broccoli) to mysterious (no idea what Twelve Predestined Affinity was). Being all vegan you can’t go wrong with being brave and ordering something adventurous sounding. We were intrigued by Fried Bumps and went for it - it turned out to be bok choy. The crispy fried jackfruit was a standout. A definite must when in the area.

name: Tinh Gia Vien
address: 7K/28 Le Thanh Ton, Hue 84 054 Vietnam
description: Hidden in an anonymous alley lies the beautiful colonial villa that hosts this restaurant. After being seated on a suggestive terrace surrounded by bonsais and old dusty memorabilia, you will be served the imperial menu. For 15$ per person the amount of food is amazing: seven courses of masterfully presented dishes will nourish your eyes before overwhelming your stomachs. You probably won't be able to finish everything, but it sure is an experience worth having.
example_reviews: Hidden in an anonymous alley lies the beautiful colonial villa that hosts this restaurant. After being seated on a suggestive terrace surrounded by bonsais and old dusty memorabilia, you will be served the imperial menu. For 15$ per person the amount of food is amazing: seven courses of masterfully presented dishes will nourish your eyes before overwhelming your stomachs. You probably won't be able to finish everything, but it sure is an experience worth having.
This restaurant serve food with interesting craft like dragon, phoenix, etc. We need to reserve the place.

Finding Tinh Gia Vien wasn't easy, it looks like a normal house with no obvious signage. Once you've found it you select from one of 3 set menus. Here each menu is based on the old imperial cuisine. Each menu has 9 dishes, which I believe because the emporer believe 9 to represent long life. You'll also find each dish is impeccably presented being served as peacocks, chickens and elephants, which is down to the emporer being a picky eater and needing every encouragement to make him finish his dinner. The prepetation for each dish must take some doing and you'll not leave the restaurant without being absolutely bloated. You'll have some photos too.

name: Sala Restaurant Hue
address: 48-50 Nguyễn Lương Bằng, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: We stayed at the Sala Hotel for 1 night including breakfast in the morning. The staff were really friendly and the hotel is spotless. We were given a fantastic room overlooking the pool. Breakfast was tasty and the staff are happy to take special requests. Would definitely recommend.
cuisines: Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: We stayed at the Sala Hotel for 1 night including breakfast in the morning. The staff were really friendly and the hotel is spotless. We were given a fantastic room overlooking the pool. Breakfast was tasty and the staff are happy to take special requests. Would definitely recommend.

Truly, five stars clean rooms, cold air conditioning restaurant was great very economical. Good value in my opinion and I’ve travelled the world. Thu sang at the front desk was very accommodating would recommend anyone travelling

Really helpful staff accommodating with issues with our booking and buses, willing to help us sort those issues. Would definitely stay here again if I was in Hue. The rooms are spacious and the pool was lovely. Breakfast was tasty and dinner menu looks extensive.

name: Tai Phu Restaurant
address: 2 Dien Bien Phu, Hue Vietnam
description: I had an absolutely fantastic experience at Hanh Restaurant! The food was simply amazing, and truly showcased the incredible flavors of Hue. Every dish I tried was bursting with authentic local flavors and made with the freshest ingredients. From the crispy banh xeo to the tender bun bo hue, everything was incredibly well-prepared and flavorful. I highly recommend this restaurant for lunch or dinner, as it truly offers a culinary experience to remember.
cuisines: American Restaurants for Large Groups in Hue
example_reviews: I had an absolutely fantastic experience at Hanh Restaurant! The food was simply amazing, and truly showcased the incredible flavors of Hue. Every dish I tried was bursting with authentic local flavors and made with the freshest ingredients. From the crispy banh xeo to the tender bun bo hue, everything was incredibly well-prepared and flavorful. I highly recommend this restaurant for lunch or dinner, as it truly offers a culinary experience to remember.

We wanted a fairly quick and simple meal on our first night in Hue, coming after a lot of travelling. This place was only a couple of minutes from the hotel and was a simple local option but it really did the job! Our waitress had enough decent English to help explain how to deal with the specialities - some DIY work needed to put it all together - but then it soon all disappeared. The price was so low we left a good tip and our waitress was happy, and so were we and suggest you try Tai Phu.

Tai Phu Restaurant, - Specialized in serving Hue special dishes: pring rolls, delicious cakes , main dishes.... - Delicious food, good taste, quick service. The price is acceptable. - The restaurant is clean, bright, tidy, have guard with motobikes parking. - If I have the opportunity to return to Hue, I will choose this restaurant first for family or friends.

name: Gem Sushi Bar
address: 6A Võ Thị Sáu, Hue 52000 Vietnam
description: A very nice vibe at this restaurant.  Very courteous staff. Nice variety of Japanese dishes.  We ordered 8 things and the bill was about $20.  Our favorite was the salmon belly - delicious.  The server made an error and gave us sashimi instead of nigiri for two dishes (more expensive) but since the cost overall was so reasonable, we didn’t complain.
example_reviews: A very nice vibe at this restaurant. Very courteous staff. Nice variety of Japanese dishes. We ordered 8 things and the bill was about $20. Our favorite was the salmon belly - delicious. The server made an error and gave us sashimi instead of nigiri for two dishes (more expensive) but since the cost overall was so reasonable, we didn’t complain.

After a few days of Vietnamese cuisines, we decided to have a change. We chance upon this corner restaurant and did not disappoint. Service staffs were extremely attentive and we took a glimpse into the kitchen behind the Japanese curtain, it was very clean and neat. We are in safe hands. We ordered some usual bites eg sushi, chawamushi, beef etc, all very yummy and splendid. We highly recommend this place for anyone wanting a different eats in Hue.

Walking around looking g for a place to eat, saw Gem. T0 make it quick, I looked at the menu and is a nice menu. Ordered edemame and spicy tuna roll. Was impressed. Ordered another one. I really enjoyed it. The waitress was very pleasant, very quick to take my ordered and very polite. This was yesterday, today I went back and had a shrimp and salmon roll which was delicious. Also had a soft shell crab roll, which pleased my stomach. To drink I had water and all of this for $10.00. The atmosphere was nice considering the restaurant is not too big. The only drawback was the location. It is located in Nguyễn Hue street ( the walking ) full of bars and loud music. However, the food made up for it.

name: Banh Khoai Hong Mai
address: 110 Dinh Tien Hoang Hue Historic Citadel, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Banh khoai Hong Mai is family restaurant.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: This restaurant only has two things on the menu (shrimp pancakes and pork skewers), and they do both of these dishes so well. The staff spoke good English and the service was friendly and fast. The dishes were really tasty and the staff showed us how to eat them which was really helpful. Would absolutely recommend this spot

Only two items on the menu - pork satay on lemongrass and Vietnamese pancakes. Awesome little place, really busy every time we walked past. The guy who ran the place was really helpful and showed us how to eat the food. Such a lovely guy. Really tasty and fresh. Definitely worth going to if you are in the area.

Two dishes but really well done. Traditional and genuine street food. Their rice crepes are delicious and leave an explosion of very pleasant flavors in the mouth. The frying is light. Very high value for money. Friendly staff and family atmosphere.

name: Cherish Hue Restaurant
address: 57 Ben Nghe Street 10th floor, Cherish Hotel, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: "For tourists, Hue has conserved the palaces and temples from the ancient Vietnamese capital, and Cherish Restaurant serves the royal cuisine, lunch and dinner, that made ​​by the traditional food chef, who has over 30 years experience in cooking. At Cherish Restaurant, visitors also are presented the fine Western dishes in original and harmonious taste. Located on the 10th floor of Cherish Hotel, the restaurant owns the finest view toward the city, overlooking Ngu Binh Mountain, Perfume River and the Ever-Growing skyline of Hue. Let's come and enjoy your time with Cherish restaurant!"
cuisines: Late Night Fusion Restaurants in Hue
Late Night European Restaurants in Hue
Late Night French Restaurants in Hue
example_reviews: Our tour group stayed here for two nights and we had breakfast at this restaurant every morning. It is one of the biggest breakfast spreads in Vietnam! The fruits are all fresh and plenty of varieties. The egg station is fully stocked with veggies and meats. They even had a huge salad spread and different cooked Veggies. Coffee is very good and fresh.
You can see nice view on top of the hotel The rooms are very nice Breakfast is served and the foods are fantastic Nice service and people are friendly
The manager was extremely kind to us. But he is also very professional. He helps us with all of our request. The food is pretty good

name: Huyen Anh
address: 52 Kim Long Street, Hue Vietnam
description: Huyen Anh Grill Pork Noodles is a hidden gem for food lovers. The restaurant serves mouthwatering grill pork noodles that will leave you craving for more. The flavors are simply delicious, with the tender grilled pork complementing the rich and aromatic broth. The portion sizes are generous, offering great value for money. The restaurant's cozy ambiance and friendly staff add to the overall dining experience. If you're a fan of Vietnamese cuisine, don't miss the opportunity to indulge in the delectable grill pork noodles at Huyen Anh Restaurant.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Huyen Anh Grill Pork Noodles is a hidden gem for food lovers. The restaurant serves mouthwatering grill pork noodles that will leave you craving for more. The flavors are simply delicious, with the tender grilled pork complementing the rich and aromatic broth. The portion sizes are generous, offering great value for money. The restaurant's cozy ambiance and friendly staff add to the overall dining experience. If you're a fan of Vietnamese cuisine, don't miss the opportunity to indulge in the delectable grill pork noodles at Huyen Anh Restaurant.

Our local guide brought here here after a visit to the DMZ. It's excellent. The menu is simple - but everything on it is tasty. We ordered BBQ rolls, bake rolls and 2 rice noodles with BBQ meat for lunch. They offer spicy or non-spicy fish sauce (nước mắm) and peanut sauce. They are all tasty in their own way.

Cracking gaffe a bit out of town which the locals like. We had tea and an absolutely cracking Banh uot thit nuong. Dip in the fish sauce. Peel a close of garlic. Add some chilli and it’s sweet pork roll delight. Get involved!!!!

name: Khong Gian Xua
address: 205 Dien Bien Phu, Hue Vietnam
description:
We visited for lunch as our tour guide suggested stopping (probably because they had a free/reduced lunch for guides bringing in tourists). Not my cup of tea personally. 

Gaudy interior with Vietnamese costume and hats to put on in the restaurant on a fancy ‘throne’. It was busy with large parties having a set buffet lunch which meant our food was slow to arrive (my meal arrived a good ten minutes after my husbands). 

The fish dish was ok, but the pork in a pot was mainly fat. There are better, more authentic, restaurants in town.
cuisines: American Restaurants for Large Groups in Hue
example_reviews: We visited for lunch as our tour guide suggested stopping (probably because they had a free/reduced lunch for guides bringing in tourists). Not my cup of tea personally. Gaudy interior with Vietnamese costume and hats to put on in the restaurant on a fancy ‘throne’. It was busy with large parties having a set buffet lunch which meant our food was slow to arrive (my meal arrived a good ten minutes after my husbands). The fish dish was ok, but the pork in a pot was mainly fat. There are better, more authentic, restaurants in town.

This spot looks great online but turned out to be just a tourist trap. The decor is supposed to be traditional Hue style but looked rather garish and more like Chinese to us. The food was mediocre and the service was even worse. We got the request to pay in VND because "the credit card machine is broken". When we came up short on cash, they suggested we could pay in USD but then completely botched up the exchange rate (not sure if that was intentional or not). The manager had to intervene and apologize for the "mathematical error". We came away with a very bad feeling about this place. There are better dining options than this in Hue, e.g. the excellent Com Nieu Chan establishments.
Very nice place with quite tasty food and choices. Very good service and atmosphere and very reasonable value for the money

name: Maison Trang 2 Restaurant
address: 94 Huyen Tran Cong Chua, Hue 49000 Vietnam
description: Maison Trang has been gaining a reputation for the high quality of authentic regional dishes that you should not miss such as Beo, Nam, Loc cake, grilled pork wrapped wet rice paper, grilled chopped pork with lemon grass and stuffed rice pancake, beef noodle, and vegetable foodâ€¦. Our traditional cuisine is so distinctive from other regions and we serve the dishes which are cooked to past emperors and royal Nguyen Dynasty.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
Thai Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: We actually went to the Madison Trang in Hue and found ourselves near here today and decided to check it out - it was AMAZING! The food is very reasonably priced, the portions were large, and the food was actually good. The Bun Bo Hue + Bun Thit Nuong was really delicious. Highly recommend

We all tried the set menu, with different Vietnamese food. We had a small taste of everything and It was simply delicious and cheap. Big portions, we almost couldn't finish everything. Thank you to Trang the owner, she is literally one of the sweetest person. Highly recommend it

My, by now 77 years old mother, and me often visit Vietnam. Hue is one of our favourites spots in the whole country. An important part of feeling so well in Hue is Trang, the owner of this Maison Trang 2 Restaurant as well as a very nice guesthouse and a beautiful other location near the beach. She became one of our best friends in Vietnam. The food being served is absolutely amazing. All dishes have the noble touch of the previous emperor cuisine. It is always difficult what to choose since every dish is a culinary story of it's own. However, prices are still very moderate. I recommand Maison Trang 2 as one of the best places to eat in the centre of Hue.

name: San May Vegeterian Restaurant
address: 08 Thanh Tinh Street, Vy Da Ward, Hue Vietnam
description: What a surprise, this vegetarian restaurant. In a dark back street you will find this beautiful restaurant with the most delicious dishes. I said a few days ago that I don't often make food surprise me anymore. Well, in that respect, this was a big party. Even the children want to come back here tomorrow (last night Hue). If you are looking for a gem and want to eat delicious food, choose this restaurant. And at least choose the pomelo salad. I could eat that every day.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: What a surprise, this vegetarian restaurant. In a dark back street you will find this beautiful restaurant with the most delicious dishes. I said a few days ago that I don't often make food surprise me anymore. Well, in that respect, this was a big party. Even the children want to come back here tomorrow (last night Hue). If you are looking for a gem and want to eat delicious food, choose this restaurant. And at least choose the pomelo salad. I could eat that every day.

Really delicious vegetarian food with a welcoming family feel! I would recommend ordering a variety of dishes to share between a few people so you can try more as they’re all so good. Tucked away in a quiet peaceful setting. Highly recommend!

Beautiful garden setting and the food was absolutely magnificent! So so so delicious... can't recommend it enough. Reasonably priced, great serving sizes. Worth noting there is no alcohol served here. Ginger lemon and lemongrass tea was recommended by the wait staff instead and was fabulous.

name: Brown Eyes Bar
address: 56 Chu Văn An, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Attentive service, decent cocktails for the price and fun-loving staff who want you to have a good time. We came here a couple of times for pre-dinner drinks and happy hour was exactly that!
cuisines: Asian Restaurants for Large Groups in Hue
Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Attentive service, decent cocktails for the price and fun-loving staff who want you to have a good time. We came here a couple of times for pre-dinner drinks and happy hour was exactly that!
The happy hour drinks are great and we have received some shots and a little snack for free. The staff is very kind. We liked it very much!

You have to visit to experience Brown Eyes. A welcome shot on arrival, followed by 2 for 1 cocktails. Sitting outside playing Jenga all night was a hoot. Seriously good fun and cheap cocktails. A thank you Highway to Help was a spectacle as well. For the drinkers worth while, non drinkers do pay a premium. A good fun place but don't expect too much!

name: Take Japanese Restaurant
address: 34 Tran Cao Van Str South Bank, Hue Vietnam
description: This is a lovely, family style, little restaurant, patronized mostly by locals and almost always full. It was about ten minutes on foot away from my hotel (Melia) and their salmon was much fresher, better tasting and about 50% cheaper than in the hotel's fancy restaurant. I came here three times and always, everything here was fresh, tasty and promptly served. Very much worth giving it a try...
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: This is a lovely, family style, little restaurant, patronized mostly by locals and almost always full. It was about ten minutes on foot away from my hotel (Melia) and their salmon was much fresher, better tasting and about 50% cheaper than in the hotel's fancy restaurant. I came here three times and always, everything here was fresh, tasty and promptly served. Very much worth giving it a try...

The setting is simple, there are private areas but we were in the main room. The service is efficient and without frills. The menu presents Japanese specialties. The sashimi and maki are delicious, the udon and ramen are decent. The room should be better soundproofed because it is extremely noisy
The best Japanese food I have ever tasted ( and I’ve had a lot!!!). Go go go. Try the rice pancake - yum. I admired the plates and they insisted I go home with one. So lovely. Can’t recommend enough.

name: Tropical Garden
address: 27 Chu Văn An, Phú Hội, Thành phố Huế, Thừa Thiên, Hue 53000 Vietnam
description:
While looking for another restaurant, we discovered the somewhat hidden Tropical Garden. What luck! Extensive menu, local prices but top quality and Huê specialties along with local wine! 
Unobtrusive welcome and attentive all-round service, including instructions on how to cut up and enjoy the somewhat difficult but very tasty Huê specialties :-)
cuisines: Late Night Italian Restaurants in Hue
example_reviews: While looking for another restaurant, we discovered the somewhat hidden Tropical Garden. What luck! Extensive menu, local prices but top quality and Huê specialties along with local wine! Unobtrusive welcome and attentive all-round service, including instructions on how to cut up and enjoy the somewhat difficult but very tasty Huê specialties :-)

What a discovery!!! We took a set of starters local cuisine (booe). The chef works plants from his “tropical garden”, the room staff - Mrs Vy - introduces us to the garden and the plants used. To do when the crowds at the restaurant allow. Great customer experience - travel in flavors.

This nice restaurant offers a relaxing atmosphere. The food was very good and we have had an excellent service. The chicken with lemon gras and the noddles with beef plus garbage with garlic have been freshly cooked. The garden area is also very nice to be seated. As it was raining we preferred to sit inside.

name: Hang Me Me
address: 29 Nguyễn Công Trứ Phú Hội, Hue Vietnam
description: We had dinner here and had the mixed banh platter for 240 dong. This was 6 types of rice "cakes" and while the taste was fine and the cakes not heavy, it wasn't enough to fill us. We ordered another type of cake and with drinks it came to 335 dong which we thought was over-priced. We have had similar food for a lot less, so we were disappointed, especially considering we then went to get a banh mi to fill us up. Ok for a snack or v light lunch, but not ok for dinner.
example_reviews: We had dinner here and had the mixed banh platter for 240 dong. This was 6 types of rice "cakes" and while the taste was fine and the cakes not heavy, it wasn't enough to fill us. We ordered another type of cake and with drinks it came to 335 dong which we thought was over-priced. We have had similar food for a lot less, so we were disappointed, especially considering we then went to get a banh mi to fill us up. Ok for a snack or v light lunch, but not ok for dinner.

We visited quite late in the evening - away from the main strip ( which is horrid and full of badly dressed Europeans) and had the restaurant to ourselves save for a young Vietnamese family who joined as we were leaving. Excellent local dumplings and dipping sauce. The lemongrass pork kebabs were also excellent. Super meal.

We come here in the first day in Hue city at 3pm based on the information of our hotel reception. They inform me that this Restaurant in the central area and we can try good traditional cakes and noodles of Hue. This restaurant located in walking are so that after eating you can go around the streets and enjoy some exciting entertainment for example coffee, bars, music ... around there. For the food i think this restaurant is ok and traditional flavor. If you don't want to go to many restaurants to try all kinds of cakes and Hue noodles you should go there. The service is fast and reasonable price.

name: Hue Cuisine & Café
address: 44 Hoàng Quốc Việt Phường An Đông, Tp Huế, Hue 0084 Vietnam
description: Enjoy this place for an unreal gastronomic experience. Very friendly staff and ambience.  Our elderly group had a ball with the food choices
cuisines: Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Enjoy this place for an unreal gastronomic experience. Very friendly staff and ambience. Our elderly group had a ball with the food choices

name: Ngu Yen - Royal Restautant In Hue
address: 01 Floor, 33 Hai Ba Trung St Thanh Lich Royal Boutique Hotel, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description:
The whole experience came with dressing up in royal costumes and listening to royal music. We were assisted with every royal dish, taking beautiful pictures and videos of our entrance, mimicking the real dinner of a King and Queen. 100% recommend the experience, also the food was top notch👍🏻. 
Front office manager Hương was especially helpful.
example_reviews: The whole experience came with dressing up in royal costumes and listening to royal music. We were assisted with every royal dish, taking beautiful pictures and videos of our entrance, mimicking the real dinner of a King and Queen. 100% recommend the experience, also the food was top notch👍🏻. Front office manager Hương was especially helpful.
Good dîner impérial. Super and so beautiful restaurant. Clother very beautiful .we are look like King and Queen .thank you so much Huong
What is wonderful night! Staff are very helpful and friendly. Royal menu was so delicious and many choice. We recommend this place to all guests ^ ^

name: Moc Vien Restaurant
address: 2/4/4A Hoai Thanh,, Hue Vietnam
description: We were with 8 people and they were so quick to arrange a round table for us. Various different dishes and everyone was happy with their food. That is what you are looking for! And be honest at very acceptable prices
example_reviews: We were with 8 people and they were so quick to arrange a round table for us. Various different dishes and everyone was happy with their food. That is what you are looking for! And be honest at very acceptable prices

I loved the ambiance of this restaurant. Beautiful plants, water features of all types, relaxed feeling were appreciated. The service was good, but unfortunately the food was nothing more than average.
Good food, nice staff, good service. We was on a company party. The decorations were ancient style but clean.

name: Eldora Restaurant
address: 60 Ben Nghe St 2F Eldora Hotel, Hue Vietnam
description: Their foods are really delicious and lots of variation. But you should try their authentic Hue foods. They are providing many of Hue traditional dishes in breakfast buffet. They are really mouth watering foods. And this restaurant have really luxury and beautiful decoration.
example_reviews: Their foods are really delicious and lots of variation. But you should try their authentic Hue foods. They are providing many of Hue traditional dishes in breakfast buffet. They are really mouth watering foods. And this restaurant have really luxury and beautiful decoration.
A wide variety of cuisine choices and this was just breakfast buffet ! Western, Asian & European diets were catered for. Decor was welcoming and comfortable. Delicious food.

We had checked into Eldora Hotel very late that night and it was pouring rain, so we decided to just have dinner at the restaurant in the hotel. Great decision! We ordered rice paper rolls for starters and a snakehead fish in claypot and chicken stirfried noodles. The rolls were very fresh, the fish was delicious and so were the noodles. This restaurant normally closes at 10 and we had arrived at about 9.49..expecting them to give us some bad news. But they happily welcomed us and the service was amazing. To top it off the hotel was great too!

name: Thanh Liêu
address: 50 Nguyen Cong Tru, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description:
The restaurant was full of locals which is always a good sign to us.
We had the big hotpot which was great. Very  good portion und super delicious.
For the dish incl. two soft drinks we paid 80,000 VND.
The other dishes also looked very tasty.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: The restaurant was full of locals which is always a good sign to us. We had the big hotpot which was great. Very good portion und super delicious. For the dish incl. two soft drinks we paid 80,000 VND. The other dishes also looked very tasty.

Not a fancy place, very local style and limited menu. That’s exact what we enjoyed, simple tasty and incredibly cheap vegan food. Yes, the ‘com dia’ is served lukewarm/cold… it’s 12k for a plate of rice, veg, tofu, the dishes are precooked so it’s served super fast. Don’t expect miracles but go with an open mind ready for local flavours and you will leave full for next to no money at all!
We just ordered a variety of food from the menu. It was all so delicious and so so cheap. Highly recommend!

name: Bun bo Hue
address: 49 Lê Lợi, Hue Vietnam
description: "Bun bo Hue" - Hue noodle soup with beef is a mocking up restaurant launched by Hue Tourism Association to promote a Hue specialty. Launching this restaurant is a part of the project: promote the most famous Hue specialty. All choosen material, cooking process was well conducted to ensure the hygiene and traditional flavor.
cuisines: BBQ Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: What a flavorful meal. We were with a large group and all seemed totally happy with this noodle soup. We know Vietnam have a lot of different noodle but this one is outstanding, the way they seasons the soup, how cooked of the pork is. Stunning.
This was the best , tastiest , Vietnamese soup I have had in Vietnam. Just an unassuming place but delicious. Located on the main thoroughfare, I bumped into it after touring the Citadel.

Perfect example of a hidden treasure! The food is exceptionally good and tasteful and very affordable! The staff/waitresses exceptionally helpful and friendly! High recommendation for this original Vietnamese restaurant!

name: Lac Thanh
address: 6A Dinh Tien Hoang, Hue Vietnam
description: After a fairly big breakfast I thought I wouldn't have much of an appetite but the food here was so incredibly tasty.  We had the Hue special pancakes (I took the veggie option, the prawns also looked very good), together with the nems because, nems.  The pancakes were so tasty served with a perfect combination of aromatic leaves, figs and a satay, the nems were delicious and lightly fried.  Superb and the owner adds a personal touch that will make this a unique and unforgettable experience.  I will enjoy using the bottle-opener!!
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: After a fairly big breakfast I thought I wouldn't have much of an appetite but the food here was so incredibly tasty. We had the Hue special pancakes (I took the veggie option, the prawns also looked very good), together with the nems because, nems. The pancakes were so tasty served with a perfect combination of aromatic leaves, figs and a satay, the nems were delicious and lightly fried. Superb and the owner adds a personal touch that will make this a unique and unforgettable experience. I will enjoy using the bottle-opener!!

Luckily we found this little restaurant as we left the Citadel. Not only did we have a delicious meal and were entertained by the one and only Mr Lac, he then organised 6 motorbikes to take us on an afternoon tour to see some of the sights and countryside near Hue. A thoroughly entertaining afternoon with great company. Highly recommend a visit if you're in Hue.
The best local food and the definitly cutest and lovliest owner :) best tour also..no tourism no cheeting..simply perfect

name: BUN BÃ’ HUáº¾ SEN RESTAURANT
address: 69 VÃµ Thá»‹ SÃ¡u 69 VÃµ Thá»‹ sÃ¡u, Hue 53000 Vietnam
description:
Next to or above the shop, the sign says "Risotto," though we're not entirely sure. Apparently, they offer Italian cuisine on the left side and Vietnamese cuisine on the right. However, we wanted to try a traditional BÃºn BÃ² Huáº¿ for breakfast, for which Huáº¿ is famous. It was available in a Vietnamese version and one for foreigners. The Vietnamese version includes pork, bones, cartilage, and blood pudding, while the version for foreigners only contains meat. We opted for the Vietnamese version with everything, and even the parts we don't usually have in soup were tender and delicious.

We felt very comfortable. The server, Vi, was very attentive and friendly, and we were able to communicate well.

Definitely our recommendation for anyone who wants to try traditional Huáº¿ cuisine in a street food setting.

Also, in terms of price and atmosphere, it's a big difference compared to the more touristy, pushy restaurants nearby.
cuisines: Late Night Italian Restaurants in Hue
