Also, in terms of price and atmosphere, it's a big difference compared to the more touristy, pushy restaurants nearby.

This Bun Bo Hue restaurant offers exceptionally flavorful dishes, earning a 5 star rating for its food. While the staff is friendly, they can be overwhelmed due to the crowded environment. The portion sizes and meat quantity may be a bit small for the price. The restaurant's location inside a run down building with minimal decor gives it an authentic feel, reminiscent of typical Vietnamese eateries. If you visit, consider ordering a large portion for a more satisfying meal. Plus, they provide iced tea, a traditional Vietnamese staple.

Best restaurant in Hue. Vietnamese and Italian cuisine with an exceptional value for money. We ate here twice, tasting both Vietnamese dishes and pizza. The Vietnamese specialties are much better than the "famous" restaurant always full of tourists in the center of Hue, generous and very tasty portions, the pizza with thin and very fragrant dough, the best we have tasted in Vietnam. With the pizza you are entitled to a free local beer. The happy hour is interesting, free bruschetta in the evening and free fruit for both lunch and dinner. Not to mention the kindness of the owner and staff. Probably due to the fact that it is outside the center it is not very popular, which is a shame, because the manager deserves much more. 5 stars well deserved!

name: Mingle Vegetarian Cafe Restaurant
address: Number 6, 14 Kiệt 42 Nguyễn Công Trứ, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: A really cozy little place. Somewhat secluded in a small backyard you can enjoy really delicious vegetarian, vegan and gluten-free food here. Many plants, relaxing music and super friendly service (Candy served us) make you forget the hustle and bustle of the city. There’s something for everyone when it comes to food, whether you’re in the mood for traditional vegetarian, Vietnamese cuisine or you’d rather have a cheese toast. The menu even shows which dishes are vegan, vegetarian or gluten-free.
cuisines: Late Night Italian Restaurants in Hue
example_reviews: A really cozy little place. Somewhat secluded in a small backyard you can enjoy really delicious vegetarian, vegan and gluten-free food here. Many plants, relaxing music and super friendly service (Candy served us) make you forget the hustle and bustle of the city. There’s something for everyone when it comes to food, whether you’re in the mood for traditional vegetarian, Vietnamese cuisine or you’d rather have a cheese toast. The menu even shows which dishes are vegan, vegetarian or gluten-free.

We stayed here twice, once for dinner and once for lunch. And especially impressed the Vietnamese dishes, so pad Thai, summer rolls, papaya salad and the mango sticky rice were excellent. Moon is a super lovely and accommodating person and the food always came fast and at the same time.

A new place for veggies and vegans in Hue (est. 3 months ago). We went there three times and tried serval dishes incl. breakfast, which is served until 5pm! Mini Banh Mi were eaten on the arrival at the table 😋 Phad Thai was yammi, French toast perfect and Flat white outstanding. But see pictures ☺️ All the best for this lovely spot and its crew.

name: Red Chilli Restaurant
address: 12 Chu Van An Street, Hue Vietnam
description: Red Chilli Restaurant located at 12 Chu Van An in Hue City... Red Chilli served the local foods and vegetarian foods...with More than 15 years in vegetarian experiences, we will serve Any hard to please client..
cuisines: American Restaurants for Large Groups in Hue
example_reviews: When you are a starving vegetarian and you come across the best vegetarian food you have had in Vietnam it's like an oasis. Other restaurants have promised but this one DELIVERED!!! Soy chicken in coconut, tofu in seaweed with pineapple, sweet and sour soy beef. It was just a gastronomic delight.

We were in Huáº¿ for three nights and ate here twice. Very friendly restaurant and a great spot for people watching. The food was excellent with complimentary spring rolls before and passion fruit for dessert. Our waitress was very attentive and convivial. I cannot remember her name but she was a student studying to be a pharmacist.

We arrived back from our DMZ tour around 19:00 o'clock in the evening, and many, many restaurants had closed because of the COVID19 virus. Red Chilli was still open and it was packed with people. Yes, we had to wait a while for our food, but the staff were working really hard to serve everyone, so a big thank you for that:)

name: Quan Banh Uot Thit Heo Quay Ba Suu
address: Loc Son, Phu Loc, Hue Vietnam
description:
Utterly outstanding rice noodles, roast pork, fresh salad and bean sprouts.

Only 1 dish in the menu. Every element of it was excellent by itself, and together made magic.

Salad and beansprouts had the texture and taste of being picked with the hour. I cannot recall having had better roast pork; soft, sweet, extremely flavoursome and the thinnest but crispiest skin I’ve ever seen.

This is a seriously 9.5/10 location. Despite being on a main road 23km from town, GO!
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Utterly outstanding rice noodles, roast pork, fresh salad and bean sprouts. Only 1 dish in the menu. Every element of it was excellent by itself, and together made magic. Salad and beansprouts had the texture and taste of being picked with the hour. I cannot recall having had better roast pork; soft, sweet, extremely flavoursome and the thinnest but crispiest skin I’ve ever seen. This is a seriously 9.5/10 location. Despite being on a main road 23km from town, GO!

Only one meal available, roast pork with the freshest salad and vegetables with dipping sauces and huge ribbon rice noodles. This is one of the best meals we have had on our family food adventure, simple fresh and so flavoursome. If you are on the road to Hue from Hoi An stop at Ba Suu on right hand side of dual carriageway ( easy to turn around )

This diner is located about 30 minutes outside of Hue, and en-route to Da Nang. They serve only one main dish for dinner: roasted pork belly with steamed rice crepe. The pork is freshly roasted, and the skin is so crispy. The portion is very generous, and best of all, the price is only 50,000 VND per person ($2.25 USD). We wished we could eat more.

name: Tu Phuong Vo Su Lau Coffee
address: Dang Thai Than Street, Thuan Thanh Ward, Hue Vietnam
description: we had a short stop here when we came to the imperial palace with our group. the space was nice, staff was good bur the highlight was the view from here.
cuisines: Seafood Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: we had a short stop here when we came to the imperial palace with our group. the space was nice, staff was good bur the highlight was the view from here.

Stopped here for a coffee (Saigon cold coffee) on a Monday evening and were stunned to have the place completely to ourselves. It’s set in a beautiful old pagoda type building, coffee and service were good and the building is wonderfully lit at night. I know some locals have some issues with the commercialisation of a building built for royals which I understand from a heritage perspective but it has been tastefully restored in my view and would recommend a visit.
A cafe with good environment both in night and day. The coffee is good and don’t forget to try the hot chocolate!

name: Nhà Hang Chay Vegetarian Restaurant
address: 103 Minh Mang, Hue Vietnam
description: Delicious vegetarian/vegan food. We ordered multiple items on the menu and loved all of them especially the pineapple fried rice, the fresh spring rolls and the fried ones, the eggplant and the fried seaweed and lemongrass. Highly recommended
cuisines: French Restaurants for Large Groups in Hue
Italian Restaurants with Buffet in Hue
Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Delicious vegetarian/vegan food. We ordered multiple items on the menu and loved all of them especially the pineapple fried rice, the fresh spring rolls and the fried ones, the eggplant and the fried seaweed and lemongrass. Highly recommended
Very good food and staff. It's a very charming place were you feel like at home. Everything perfect, and specially, the attention of Ha...so cute. Totally recomended

We stayed at the resort across the street. Rather than eating overpriced pizza at the resort’s restaurant, we ventured out to this living room restaurant across the street. We were welcomed by three generations of the family running this lovely restaurant. While their English was poor, we hit it off right away. After a quick look at the menu, the waitress brought us the most delicious hotpot and amazing vegetarian dishes. The food was fresh, extremely tasty and very affordable (the bill for 5, including drinks, equalled the price of one pizza at the resort) and the service was quick, warm and efficient. The entire experience was as authentic as it can be. We promised to return the next day.

name: Com Hen Hoa Dong
address: 64/7 Ung Binh Vy Da, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description:
This place is incredible. The Bun hen is fantastic. The briny/seafood broth is great. All the extra things they do like Banh loc, Banh neo and hen xao all very flavourful. The che bap is like something comforting from childhood. Amazing price and owners lovely (happy to show us ignorant tourists how to eat everything with all the appropriate accompaniments). Proper place where the local folk eat.

Absolutely gutted I can't come back to eat there again and again. Go and have a great time munching away to your heart's content. Value is incredible for such great food. You won't regret it!
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: This place is incredible. The Bun hen is fantastic. The briny/seafood broth is great. All the extra things they do like Banh loc, Banh neo and hen xao all very flavourful. The che bap is like something comforting from childhood. Amazing price and owners lovely (happy to show us ignorant tourists how to eat everything with all the appropriate accompaniments). Proper place where the local folk eat. Absolutely gutted I can't come back to eat there again and again. Go and have a great time munching away to your heart's content. Value is incredible for such great food. You won't regret it!

A bit out of the way but worth it!!! Apparently the little island in Hue invented the 'com hen' dish (rice with baby clams). Read a blog that mentioned it as the best com hen they had so had to check it out... wow so tasty! The staff speak a little English, it is off the beaten track and its a very local establishment (i.e. not the cleanest) but so cheap and tasty! I had the noodles with clams (with a side of broth) and the fried noodles with a cracker. Would recommend both

We walked here one evening for dinner. It is a little bit of a walk from the main town, but the walk is very safe and interesting in itself. The staff were very nice and gave us English menus. We ordered bun hen, che bap, and sodas. The food was excellent, one of the best meals I had in Vietnam. I highly recommend making the trek to this restaurant while you are in Hue.

name: Hueritage
address: Le Duan Street, Hue City, Hue 0234 Vietnam
description: Gracefully poised on the poetic banks of the Perfume River, Hueritage is not merely a restaurant—it is a living symbol of harmony between the timeless spirit of Hue’s heritage and the pinnacle of culinary artistry. With a heartfelt mission to honor cultural legacy, Hueritage offers a one-of-a-kind fine dining experience on water, where every detail is crafted to awaken the senses and elevate the soul.
example_reviews: I have been on a boat in Hue couple times but this one is different. Starting with the port I was surprised with their location. I think they have the best spot in the river. Walking to the boat it was stunning not only the outside but the interior and decoration inside the boat was incredible. We love it so much it was perfect for our family dinner. Definitely recommend to anyone who wanna experience boating along the perfume river.

name: CHAY Corner - Vietnamese Dumplings
address: 44 Lê Ng. Cát Thủy Xuân, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: This corner is born in 2022, the second branch of CHAY corner chain. CHAY corner has already appeared in Da Nang and Hue. They serve Vegan/Vegetarian food, expecially authentic Vietnamese Dumplings.
cuisines: Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Amazing service by Na! She cooked all 5 mains and multiple sides by herself - and so fast. Every meal was presented beautifully and absolutely delicious. Lovely atmosphere, great location and had a great chat with Na:)

A great truly local experience with great dumplings and a very warm host! Upon arrival the restaurant seemed closed but was openend instantly. We were welcomed with fruit and had a variety of dumplings and sushi. A real gem.

Wonderful and charming little place tucked away and well worth coming to. Lovely elderly lady who welcomes you and cooks up fantastic vegetarian food. Would thoroughly recommend to anyone (I'm not a vegetarian by any stretch and really enjoyed it)

name: Hoang Phu Restaurant
address: 5 Nguyen Thai Hoc, Hue Vietnam
description: Hoang Phu Restaurant is a fine dining restaurant featuring Hue Royal Cuisine since 1994. Our menu are diverse, ranging from Royal Menu, A La Carte Menu, to European Menu.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: In addition to seeing the monuments of the royal city, you must try to taste the food of the Emperor Nguyen, a fine-tasting vision and taste of the best experience, starting with this (Ancient Royal Restaurant) the world's most respected "Dragon Feng dancing Emperor's banquet". Exquisite dishes, elegant dining environment, in showing the restaurant to give a forever unforgettable banquet, delicious combination with the fruit of the vivid sculptures, this is definitely not the ordinary restaurant can compare! Having not eaten the Emperor's banquet without a dragon-fucking fan dance, is equivalent to not having been harmonized!

This restaurant is located directly opposite Romance Hotel in Hue. We had duck in plum sauce, vege soup, crispy fish balls and sliced salami and savory fried rice all decorated with elaborate fruit/vege carvings of peacock.

The one thing that got the 3 stars was the presentation of the food! It was beautiful however the food was very average. Service was also average. The entertainment provided ( royal music) becomes annoying after the 3rd song. Be careful, they do not accept credit cards!

name: Quan Cam - Bun Bo Hue
address: 38 Tran Van Cao Street, Hue Vietnam
description: Called in here on our first stop of a street and food walking tour of Hue. A small roadside restaurant where you get a large bowl of soup, the noodle soup is very nice. It is a restaurant where if you were by yourself, you would probably keep walking, but I am so glad we went in.
cuisines: Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Called in here on our first stop of a street and food walking tour of Hue. A small roadside restaurant where you get a large bowl of soup, the noodle soup is very nice. It is a restaurant where if you were by yourself, you would probably keep walking, but I am so glad we went in.

We asked our hotel for a nearby Bun Bo place and they recommended this spot. It was perfect. They only do Bun Bo and so know what you want as soon as you arrive, used by locals and with local prices, food is delicious and restaurant is clean with friendly owners. Would recommend!
Come here for the best bun bo hue. That's all they sell and it is delicious!! It is pricier than other places but it's so good and tons of locals eat here!! And it has all the fixins'!!

name: Cơm Niêu Bánh Gánh 2
address: 47 Ông Ich Khiêm, Hue 49000 Vietnam
description: Bánh Gánh 2 Restaurant: private space, Hue specialties, traditional family clay pot rice, located at 47 Ông Ích Khiêm.
cuisines: French Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: This is the best place to try local Hue cuisine. The staff were so friendly and welcoming from the moment we walked in the door, made recommendations and showed us how to eat the local specialities. We will certainly be back!

Bánh Gánh is a hidden gem that truly captures the essence of Vietnamese cuisine. The moment you step in, you're greeted with a cozy, rustic atmosphere that feels both nostalgic and welcoming. The menu offers a wide range of traditional dishes, each bursting with authentic flavors. I was particularly impressed by the Bánh Xèo, which was crispy and perfectly balanced in taste. The staff were friendly and attentive, ensuring a pleasant dining experience. Bánh Gánh is a place where every dish feels like a comforting reminder of home, making it a must-visit for anyone craving genuine Vietnamese food.
Delicious food - very flexible concerning the order, as I'm not eating pork. Service super friendly, very helpful and accommodating. 5 stars!

name: Kakarotto Udon & Tempura
address: 42 bến nghé, phường phú hội, Hue Vietnam
description: Nestled in the heart of Hue, Vietnam, Kakarotto Udon & Tempura invites you on an unforgettable journey through the rich and unique flavors of Japan. At Kakarotto, we have mastered the art of creating authentic Japanese Udon and Tempura dishes, crafted with a dash of Vietnamese hospitality. This represents our commitment to serving not just delectable cuisine but also ensuring that every guest feels cherished. Our menu showcases the best of Japanese culinary traditions. From the comforting warmth of a steaming bowl of Udon to the crispy, delicate Tempura, every dish is prepared with meticulous attention to detail. Our ingredients are carefully selected to ensure that each bite brings you a taste of Japan's culinary heritage. But it's not just about the food; it's about the experience. We welcome you into our cozy, inviting restaurant, where you can savor the flavors of Japan in a tranquil, stylish atmosphere. Our staff is dedicated to making your visit a delightful one, always ready with a warm smile and a willingness to assist. We are proud to be a part of the vibrant Hue community, and we've been embraced by the local people who appreciate and celebrate diverse cuisines. It is the fusion of Japanese tradition and Vietnamese hospitality that sets Kakarotto apart. Come and join us in celebrating the best of both worlds, where Japan meets Vietnam, and flavors blend to create a culinary experience that is truly exceptional. Kakarotto Udon & Tempura is not just a restaurant; it's a place where food and culture come together to create lasting memories. We look forward to serving you and making your dining experience memorable. Arigato Gozaimasu!
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: I visited with my family and we had a great time. The restaurant is located at the center of city, so Its pretty easy to find. The staff were very attentive and helpful, and they gave us some good recommendations. We ordered different kinds of udon, such as beef, seafood, and curry. The noodles were thick and chewy, and the broth was flavorful and rich. The portions were generous and the prices were reasonable. We will definitely come back and try more dishes next time

This is truly one of the best udon restaurants! The udon noodles are fresh and springy, and the broth has a deep, rich flavor. The restaurant atmosphere is clean and cozy, and the staff is very friendly. The food comes out quickly and the prices are very reasonable. This is definitely a place worth visiting again and I would highly recommend it to my friends. This place deserves 5 stars!" ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
So so good!!! The found was exceptional and really good value. Lots of choice and everything is truly delicious :) would return

name: Ngon' Pizza - Steak - Ribs
address: 44 Chu Văn An Phường Phú Hội, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description:
Really tasty burritos and lovely staff at this small pizza restaurant. Owner so eager to please. Kitchen arrangements are unusual in that they source from various restaurants so our burritos came from
mexican kitchen few doors away. They were hot and delicious snd came with all the usual extras like sour cream etc. 
Also had delicious pancakes and icecream.
cuisines: Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Really tasty burritos and lovely staff at this small pizza restaurant. Owner so eager to please. Kitchen arrangements are unusual in that they source from various restaurants so our burritos came from mexican kitchen few doors away. They were hot and delicious snd came with all the usual extras like sour cream etc. Also had delicious pancakes and icecream.

Had a long day sat in a minibus looking at sights and noodles and rice weren’t going to cut it and just wanted some comfort food and this place was opposite where we were staying so popped in. As with nearly everywhere in Vietnam the service was friendly and quick and the pizza was amazing !!!! Garlic bread made from banh mi bread was outstanding. Definitely what we needed, so if you want something tasty that reminds you of home give it a go.
A nice place to eat pizza in Hue. Food is good and service is amazing. It located in the center area. The beefsteak is excellent too. Highly recommend!

name: Tachi - Vietnamese Seafood
address: 24 Nguyen Thai Hoc, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description:
A good seafood restaurant which serves just fish and seafood. We has sea snail spring rolls, which were fantastic. We also had octopus, perfume river snail and mixed seafood with rice.
I really enjoyed it and would recommend it if you’re a lover of seafood
cuisines: Late Night Italian Restaurants in Hue
example_reviews: A good seafood restaurant which serves just fish and seafood. We has sea snail spring rolls, which were fantastic. We also had octopus, perfume river snail and mixed seafood with rice. I really enjoyed it and would recommend it if you’re a lover of seafood
Amazing! Some of the best seafood I’ve ever eaten. Had the clams in lemongrass, ginger and galangal, loads of flavour, a good portion and great value. Staff were friendly.

To make it fast and easy for everybody... Take a look at the pictures! The food is amazing, the prices are very good and the service are very nice and friendly! You feel like home! I'm chef myself since over 20 years and this restaurant was my favorite place in huê!

name: Pho Sai Gon
address: 10 Nguyen Van Cu Tp, Hue Vietnam
description: This was me and my family's last meal in hue. We decided to eat at a local restaurant that served original Vietnamese dishes and this was it. We had Pho and the meal ticked all the boxes. If you love local restaurants with good food then this is the one for you. 🍜
example_reviews: This was me and my family's last meal in hue. We decided to eat at a local restaurant that served original Vietnamese dishes and this was it. We had Pho and the meal ticked all the boxes. If you love local restaurants with good food then this is the one for you. 🍜

The staff at the Thanh Lich Boutique (?) Hotel recommended this place as being close with good dry Pho noodles. Turned out to be the best place we've eaten at here in Hue. Large choice of dishes (all local) in Vietnamese and English. Prices comparable to other similar style establishments. 6 staff were busy cleaning, helping customers and serving very efficiently. Cute little dog (half Corgi, half German Shepherd or some such mutt) enjoying the attention of us at least. Had dry egg noodles with Aussie beef and wife had beef salad. And unlike some places it had chilli paste, fish sauce, soy sauce and vinegar to allow one to dress it to your taste. Recommend it.
One of the best local restuarant! We had chicken pho and beef noodles in tomato soup. Both were great. The warm bun pao is good for a rainy chilly day too.

name: Revolution Express Lang Co
address: 86M Trinh To Tam, Lang Co, Phu Loc, Thua Thien, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Nestled amongst the lush hillside of Lang Co Station, the first Revolution Express track side restaurant at Lang Co. Join us for local delicacies, draft beers, internationally acclaimed pizzas, and various entertaining activities.
cuisines: Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Went to Revulsion Express Lang co restaurant for lunch, firstly what an amazing building and restoration they have done on the outside and inside of the station, the attention to detail and the architecture of the building is beautiful. The food was delicious and the staff were always smiling and always happy to help. Highly recommend going here for lunch or a few drinks, really great place, and if you’re into railway it’s worth going to see the station.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Lang Co Station Restaurant, and I was truly impressed. The stunning restoration of the historic train station is a testament to meticulous attention to detail and a deep appreciation for the building's heritage. The food was delicious, and the service provided by Le was exceptional. Her friendly and attentive demeanor made the dining experience even more enjoyable. I highly recommend visiting Lang Co Station for a unique and memorable meal.

Really enjoyed this atmospheric restaurant. Great Chicken Burger, a ginger beer in an air conditioned space. Based right at the Lang Co rail station. Nice coffee list as well before continuing journey over the Hai Van Pass

name: NhÃ  HÃ ng KTV
address: 59 XuÃ¢n Thuá»·, Vá»¹ Dáº¡, Hue 49000 Vietnam
description: Western European style restaurant (France). Garden villa in French architecture. Delicious food, reasonable prices. Polite staff. Suitable for families, couples, experiences.
example_reviews: Western European style restaurant (France). Garden villa in French architecture. Delicious food, reasonable prices. Polite staff. Suitable for families, couples, experiences.
Delicious food, professional and enthusiastic service staff. The restaurant campus is spacious and airy...we will come back to this placeðŸ˜Š
I went on a tour so I don't know the price. a lot of food. Friendly, enthusiastic staff, spacious restaurant space.

name: Burger Shack Hue - Lều Hamburgers
address: 34 võ thị sáu, tp huế, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Great on-the-spot made burgers and really nice they are made by a really nice Vietnamese guy who's learning English on the side. The veggie burger was delicious (the Ms says) and the other burgers are great value for the price. Recommend.
cuisines: Late Night Italian Restaurants in Hue
example_reviews: Great on-the-spot made burgers and really nice they are made by a really nice Vietnamese guy who's learning English on the side. The veggie burger was delicious (the Ms says) and the other burgers are great value for the price. Recommend.

A small hole in the wall dishing out good value veggie burgers, fries, and beers. A perfect break from Vietnamese food. There's a couple of small tables where you can sit, eat, and watch the world go by.

After a full day motorbiking from Hoi An without lunch we were craving a dirty burger. Found this place on google as recommended. It's really hard to find but basically its next to Madam Thu's but it's a tiny kiosk so look hard and you'll see it. Perhaps we were delirious but we walked up and down the street a few times before we found it! When they say single they mean teeny tiny patty, we were a bit disappointed but it was still nice. But go for the double!! Its not a double like you get in maccy d's but a full bun sized patty. We both had the bacon burger and it was amazing, we very nearly went up for another!! Chips were nice too.

name: Phuoc Thanh Garden Restaurant
address: 30 Pham Ngu Lao St, Hue Vietnam
description: This restaurant has a very pleasant interior, with the typical Vietnamese/Western menu. The food was very good. As in many other places in Vietnam,  they bring dishes either all together or in our case, the rice side order soon after the appetizer. The staff's English is basic but it was not a problem to order. They do not accept credit cards. All other customers (many) were Vietnamese so it must be good!
cuisines: Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: This restaurant has a very pleasant interior, with the typical Vietnamese/Western menu. The food was very good. As in many other places in Vietnam, they bring dishes either all together or in our case, the rice side order soon after the appetizer. The staff's English is basic but it was not a problem to order. They do not accept credit cards. All other customers (many) were Vietnamese so it must be good!

Had dinner after busy day shopping in Hoi An. Restaurant was fully packed with dinners in long table setting. We had pho, rice, vege soup, crispy fried fish, rice paper spring rolls, savory pork and mung bean vermicelli.

Set back from the street so a more relaxed environment to enjoy a meal. Outdoor seating is available however, the front of the restaurant opens up so you can still feel outdoors even if indoors. Long tables encourages groups to come here. The staff were pleasant.

name: Quán Sò Huế
address: 15 Hoàng Văn Thụ An Đông, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: We serve seafood dishes, we have the best clams for you to choose and we have many different seafood you can try in your meal . Babylonia tesselata , oysters, squid ...
example_reviews: This place is SO GOOD and SO AFFORDABLE! I wanted to eat more but went for a night snack and had already eaten dinner. I thought I would be able to find other places in Vietnam that would be the same if not better but I did not! No need to go to expensive seafood places, just come here! The crab claws are SPICYYYY, I can't hold my own spice but this was too much for me. The clams were delicioussss. I recommend getting the sampler to try then order what you liked from it.

We had prawns in a spicy garlic sauce, razor clams in lemongrass, mussels in this amazing sauce with peanuts and steamed clams. It was all so fresh - we ordered the clams because we saw them being delivered to the restaurant. I only wish I could read the menu which seemed only to be in Vietnamese - it looks so extensive. We ended up pointing to pictures on the wall. The seafood here was different and really refreshing from some of the more standard places. It was a bit difficult to find and so unassuming but what a great place!!!

We had the crab claws, oysters and prawns here. The crab claws were messy but so worth it, the oysters were unlike anything else (think garlic, shallots and herbs) and the skewered prawns were sumptuous! These dishes were doused with seasoning and sauces which we loved- but yes, quite messy! (Napkins and bathroom obviously available though). Great with a beer as a starter to a night out in Hue!

name: Hi Boss restaurant
address: 25 Lê Quý Đôn, Hue 52000 Vietnam
cuisines: American Restaurants for Large Groups in Hue

name: Ba Do
address: 7 Nguyen Binh Khiem St Hue, Hue Vietnam
description:
When visiting Hue, there are some local dishes one must try. Banh beo is one of those, and the serving I had at Ba Do was probably the best I ever had. I also discovered a new dish (to me) called 'ram it'. It's sticky rice on top of a deep fried sticky rice/shrimp cracker, topped with shredded shrimp - amazing!

Highly recommend this place, although visitors might want to visit with someone who can speak Vietnamese (I guess pointing to the simple menu would work too).
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: When visiting Hue, there are some local dishes one must try. Banh beo is one of those, and the serving I had at Ba Do was probably the best I ever had. I also discovered a new dish (to me) called 'ram it'. It's sticky rice on top of a deep fried sticky rice/shrimp cracker, topped with shredded shrimp - amazing! Highly recommend this place, although visitors might want to visit with someone who can speak Vietnamese (I guess pointing to the simple menu would work too).

The set-up of this Vietnamese restaurant is simply amazing! The decor is so beautiful, and the ambiance is elegant and sophisticated. The attention to detail in every aspect of the restaurant is truly impressive. The lighting, music, and aroma all work together to create a warm and inviting atmosphere that makes you feel relaxed and at ease.

Authentic so the place is very crowded at lunch. We had Hue foods in many places and love this place most. Price is low, not tourist price like in downtown. We rented a scooter from our hotel so we rode here after visiting Thuan An Beach.

name: Biet Phu Thao Nhi
address: Thon Cu Chanh 1 Huong Thuy, Hue Vietnam
description:
Our tour group came by to this restaurant for lunch after visiting Khai Dinh Tomb nearby, about a good 3~5min drive. The restaurant is big and surrounded by a nicely curated home garden with lots of greenery， trees, flowers, grassland, wooden houses and ponds. It's as if one is out in the mother nature.

We were led to the tables and soon food started serving. There were several dishes, all authentic local dishes like stir fried vegetables of cabbage and eggplant, salad, fried eggs, sweet and sour chicken, fried fishes, soup and fruit, banana. We were also served Jasmine tea. And the food were nice and yummy, well presented and tasted well. We enjoyed the food, but the service needed to buck up as staff served the wrong food and also took a long while to refill the tea although the restaurant was not that crowded when we were there but shortly after our meal, we saw many tourist buses came by with many diners walking in!
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Our tour group came by to this restaurant for lunch after visiting Khai Dinh Tomb nearby, about a good 3~5min drive. The restaurant is big and surrounded by a nicely curated home garden with lots of greenery， trees, flowers, grassland, wooden houses and ponds. It's as if one is out in the mother nature. We were led to the tables and soon food started serving. There were several dishes, all authentic local dishes like stir fried vegetables of cabbage and eggplant, salad, fried eggs, sweet and sour chicken, fried fishes, soup and fruit, banana. We were also served Jasmine tea. And the food were nice and yummy, well presented and tasted well. We enjoyed the food, but the service needed to buck up as staff served the wrong food and also took a long while to refill the tea although the restaurant was not that crowded when we were there but shortly after our meal, we saw many tourist buses came by with many diners walking in!

A group of seven of us travelling together visited this restaurant for lunch on 18/01/2018. To enter the restaurant we walked past trees in the form of an arch and along a paved pathway. The building itself was old though decorated in good taste. The surrounding well maintained gardens are quite large with ponds and water features. The food is served in a number of dining halls in different buildings and boast of over 800 seats. We were well received and seated at a clean well prepared table. The staff were attentive and spoke reasonable English. The food served was very tasty and delicious to the tongue. I liked the well prepared sweet and sour dishes. The prawns were out of this world!!

After visiting the King Tomb, our guide took us to this restaurant for lunch. It has such a lovely gardern and fancy house that we felt so relaxing after strolling around. Foods were good with nice decoration. We were served quickly by friendly staffs.

name: Soul Kitchen
address: Số 4 kiệt 42 Nguyễn Công Trứ, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: I ordered #2, chicken In spicy sauce, under the chicken heading.  Do not think this is a meal.  It is snack, 3 chicken wings and few fries and a bit of lettuce.  The reason I gave this place 5 stars is that these were very yummy wings that costs 50 VDN so I don’t feel cheated.
cuisines: Late Night Italian Restaurants in Hue
example_reviews: I ordered #2, chicken In spicy sauce, under the chicken heading. Do not think this is a meal. It is snack, 3 chicken wings and few fries and a bit of lettuce. The reason I gave this place 5 stars is that these were very yummy wings that costs 50 VDN so I don’t feel cheated.

The restaurant is somewhat hidden in an alley away from the hustle and bustle. We had Bulgogi, which was very tasty with lots of Korean ingredients. The staff is young and very motivated and attentive. Their English skills were also good. Highly recommended!
Korean Food with extremely good ambience! Well performed live music after 8 p.m.. Prices above average, but worth the experience.

name: The Beach Bar Hue
address: Xuan An Phu Thuan Village, Hue Vietnam
description:
Stayed for 3 nights at the Beach Bar Hotel and took all 3 meals of the day there because I just didn't want to get out of this wonderful garden right by the sea. My stomach thanked me! Everything freshly prepared with fresh utensils and the necessary care. 
Are not street food prices, but still incredibly cheap and really delicious for a European.
cuisines: Italian Restaurants with Buffet in Hue
Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Stayed for 3 nights at the Beach Bar Hotel and took all 3 meals of the day there because I just didn't want to get out of this wonderful garden right by the sea. My stomach thanked me! Everything freshly prepared with fresh utensils and the necessary care. Are not street food prices, but still incredibly cheap and really delicious for a European.

A nice, quiet and clean beach, with a nice bar with friendly staff. Pizza was the best we had in Vietnam. You pay an entrance fee but can spent this at food and drinks. So in the you pay no fee at all :) For us it was a really good place to relax and swim!

We were staying in Hue and wanted a restful day on the beach. The beach bar did not disappoint! We paid 100000 dong each to access the private beach for the day but this was able to be used to against food and drinks which was delicious and towels. The beach is beautiful and clean , the local fishermen were working which was a delight to watch. We took a taxi to and from Hue organised by our hotel and it was very reasonable. Definitely recommend a relaxing day there after spending a day visiting the tourist sights.

name: Tịnh Tâm Vegan
address: 53 Nguyễn Công Trứ, Hue 52000 Vietnam
description:
Tasty food. We had the soya chicken in lemongrass, soya beef noodles, white rice and the eggplant dish. They were all very nice! Smaller portion sizes to other places we have visited, but still very good sizes! Fairly priced. 

Negative: we ordered a pineapple juice and it had a couple of floating bugs in it and didn't feel like fresh pineapple juice.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Tasty food. We had the soya chicken in lemongrass, soya beef noodles, white rice and the eggplant dish. They were all very nice! Smaller portion sizes to other places we have visited, but still very good sizes! Fairly priced. Negative: we ordered a pineapple juice and it had a couple of floating bugs in it and didn't feel like fresh pineapple juice.

The food was sooooo delicious, I like eating meat, I'm always curious and I try lots of things. For me this wasn't a "substitute cuisine", but an excellent kitchen with my own recipes. The fact that the service was top notch and the prices too only made it even better. I would have willingly paid more.

Amazing food!! Truely!! Quality! And on top of that, HONEST & friendly staff!! So I didn’t have cash on me & had to run & grab some dong, the staff member wouldn’t accept more than I tried to pay because she knew I didn’t realise the value & was giving a lot. She quickly said no & gave me change. She was so accomodating to make the fan on me & told me to have a seat to wait for my taxi even though they had closed. ❤️ Recommend the fried rice!

name: Al Pomodoro Restaurant, Hue
address: 38 Nguyen Sinh Cung, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: We stumbled upon this restaurant as it was close to our accommodation, and were very pleased with our find! We ordered vietnamese food; our meal was served quickly and was truly delicious. One of the best meals we've had in Vietnam so far. Our server Phong spoke great English and served us promptly and efficiently. He also brought us complimentary passion fruit at the end of our meal. Would recommend!
cuisines: Late Night Vietnamese Restaurants in Hue
Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: We stumbled upon this restaurant as it was close to our accommodation, and were very pleased with our find! We ordered vietnamese food; our meal was served quickly and was truly delicious. One of the best meals we've had in Vietnam so far. Our server Phong spoke great English and served us promptly and efficiently. He also brought us complimentary passion fruit at the end of our meal. Would recommend!
Highly recommended place. Very nice waitress and high quality products, pizza was really good :). We could try local beer for free :). Awesome.
Very nice Italian meal, really good portion. The waitress Dal was very friendly and helpful. Good English, will definitely visit again

name: T.O Quan
address: 4/1 Le Hong Phong, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Went here for eating frogs, so tasteful! Great place! The menu is in Vietnamese so Google can be useful.
example_reviews: Went here for eating frogs, so tasteful! Great place! The menu is in Vietnamese so Google can be useful.

This restaurant serves a wide range of food including seafood, vietnam traditional food... However, most of their food is cooked in an innovative way. The taste is pretty good. If you have a chance go to Hue, go to here and try. The best one i have eaten in Vietnam.

name: Mayla Healthy Coffee & Bakery
address: 37B Nguyen Thai Hoc, Hue Vietnam
description: Walked past and thought I'd buy a couple of Banh Mi. Ordered the spicy fish and then went back for another 2 more as they were delicious! The best I've had in Vietnam yet. And lovely service with a smile. Will definitely be returning .
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Walked past and thought I'd buy a couple of Banh Mi. Ordered the spicy fish and then went back for another 2 more as they were delicious! The best I've had in Vietnam yet. And lovely service with a smile. Will definitely be returning .
Amazing, healthy egg banh mi! More amazing is their freshly baked and very healthy bread! Highly recommend! And the Matcha Muoi-delicious!

I hopped in looking for some vegan cookies, and lo and behold there were several locally-produced kinds. The staff member I spoke with was helpful in clarifying the nature of the ingredients (contained in one of the products I took an interest in).

name: Green Garden Hue Restaurant & Cafe
address: 97B Nguyen Hoang Street, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Green Garden Hue Restaurant is located in 97B Nguyen Hoang - Hue City - Viet Nam. That is big model restaurant with two storeys , on 10.000m2 campus.With luxurious and modern design, can accommodate 1000 guests per turn. The restaurant serves Eurasian food and especially has a lunch buffet with a menu of 50 Hue specilities at a very reasonale prices. Staff dedicated and professional service.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: I, who really love to eat VN food, went to birthday trip to Vietnam and my beatiful friend, Moona, introduced this restaurant to me. There were lots of extraordinary food that I have never experienced and workers are really friendly to people who visit the restaurant. Moreover, the owner of the restaurant said hello and goodbye to each visitors kindly and gave traditional presents too. I fell in love with this place and I am willing to visit once again

What an amazing place!!! I had a lot of fun and was really enjoy the dinner with my friends in there. The thing I love the most is services, they are very professional and friendly which I care the most. However, instead of Vietnamese songs, international songs could be better in that environment!!! Btw I love it 😻.

Visited the Restaurant with our Travel Group & enjoyed the Food, Hospitality & friendly staff at this establishment. Highly recommended for Groups. Would frequent again on my next trip to Hue, Vietnam, individually or as part of a a Group.

name: Banana Flower Restaurant
address: 19 Vo Thi Sau Street Phu Hoi Ward, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Banana flower restaurant is the big restaurant, It is located on the foreigne town of Hue city, looking from outside the restaurant looks like the ancient villa with the beautiful european architecture. With a capacity of 300 seats and the more fine decorations which creat a luxurious and elegant restaurant.
cuisines: Late Night European Restaurants in Hue
Late Night French Restaurants in Hue
Italian Restaurants for Large Groups in Hue
example_reviews: We came here for a group dinner whilst on our Vietnam guided tour. Both when we arrived and also when we left we were the only people in the restaurant and have to say there was a complete lack of atmosphere. The food was very acceptable with a set menu being the choice of our guide, this was pre booked. All dishes were well cooked and decently presented, with special attention given to 2 vegetarians in our group. The food was plentiful and a very nice variety. There seemed to be a little bit of an undercurrent going on as the service seemed a little hurried and there were not many smiling happy faces amongst the staff, this actually appeared to break as either the owner or manager was actually shouting both in the background and even in the restaurant. This became the talking point of the night rather than the quality of the dinner.
Some of the dishes they served up were a talking piece. Once again great food. Beer cold. Will not disappoint
A nice, if unremarkable, restaurant that serves vietnamese food. Service was pleasant enough and the toilets were clean: sometimes, that's enough :).

name: Nhà Hàng Chay Hương Mai
address: 16 Kiệt 64 Nguyễn Công Trứ, Hue Vietnam
description: Excellent vegan meals from a very long selection of food. Great charming service. Sadly there were almost no other guests despite the restaurant having so much seating.
cuisines: European Restaurants for Large Groups in Hue
French Restaurants for Large Groups in Hue
Italian Restaurants with Buffet in Hue
example_reviews: Excellent vegan meals from a very long selection of food. Great charming service. Sadly there were almost no other guests despite the restaurant having so much seating.
This place is suitable for vegetarian food enthusiasts like me. The space is cool and great.

name: Giao Mua Cafe
address: 6/57 Nguyen Cong Tru Street, Phu Hoi Ward, Hue Vietnam
description: Hanoi’s cutest cafe placed in the center of Hanoi. The service was amazing and they made the best coffee with cutest latte art! Would recommend and visit this place again
example_reviews: Hanoi’s cutest cafe placed in the center of Hanoi. The service was amazing and they made the best coffee with cutest latte art! Would recommend and visit this place again
we wre staying across the Street at Serene Shining Hotel, and we decided to have a drink there. We really loved it, great jungle decoration, great drinks, super fiendly staff! Lovely!!!

Giao Mua is a terrific little coffee lounge popular with local young people to meet for dates. It has dark wood decor and furniture set around a relaxing pond. Despite the soothing decor, the place buzzes with life. It is full of young locals enjoying a cup of coffee, chatting and flirting. The front is full of motos. Do not go if you are in a rush. This is a place to order a traditional Vietnamese coffee then sit back and relax while the coffee drips through the filter. The cups come with tea lights underneath to keep the coffee warm as you while away the evening sipping your coffee and chatting. Giao Mua is at the end of a lane across from the Serene Shining Hotel, a couple of minute walk from the main tourist bar area.

name: Nha Hang Gao
address: 60 Hai Ba Trung, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: The local restaurant with nice ancient Hue house
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: This amazing restaurant is only a few minutes walk from our hotel Thanh Lịch. We recently came for dinner on a cold, wet, rainy night! Beautiful, serene setting with carved wood/bamboo furniture, tall beams and columns, waterfall, koi pond, felt like we were dinning in a pagoda! We had grilled pork skewers, beef stir-fry with broccoli, stir-fry morning glory with garlic, and bitter melon soup. All served with ‘cơm niêu’ rice cooked in clay pot. Everything was excellent! But we especially enjoyed the soup: ‘khổ qua’ bitter melon stuffed with pork and mushroom, cooked in a steamy hot broth, topped with green onion and cilantro. Simple yet so delicious, so perfect for a cold rainy night! Wonderful service, the waitresses were super nice, friendly. Highly recommend.

The food here was not just good but downright stunning and tasty. From the braised fish dish to roasted pork with anchovy fish sauce, each dish left a lasting impression. Returning to Vietnam after a considerable time away, indulging in the local cuisine at this restaurant felt like a heartfelt reunion with the flavors of home. The setting, with its captivating view, made it a perfect spot for a nice family evening. In essence, this restaurant became more than just a place to dine; it became a bridge to the past, a place where the heart and taste buds reunite with the flavors of home. A truly special experience for anyone craving a taste of their own traditions after being away. What stood out equally was the service – the server was incredibly helpful and friendly, making the experience all the more enjoyable. In a nutshell, this place doesn't just serve food; it crafts an unforgettable dining experience, blending delicious dishes with a warm atmosphere and fantastic service. A must-try in Vietnam!

Good food. Good location. Good service. They have many choices such as chicken, beef, frogs…Highly recommended. I visited with my family in Jan 2024 ❤️. I will come back later if i have chance to visit Hue again.

name: Le's Garden Bar
address: 28 Vo Thi Sau, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Warmest greetings from Le's Garden Bar Hue.Le's Garden Bar is centrally located at 14 Pham Ngu Lao Street, the busiest and most lively hustle and bustle of Hue which is inspired with a proper mixed of ancient house and modern facility. The impressive decors of hand paintings and shade of tropical garden certainly enables you to embrace a relaxing and peaceful momentof noise-free hustle and bustle city. Free wifi and complimentary 24/7 pool table are always at your service. Either separate open air corners or closed air-comditioned lounge is covered with requested live music and nightly DJ performance.A wide variety of tasty traditional local cuisine and proper standard Western delights served with endless choice of mixed drinks throughout the most generous happy hours always are available at Le's Garden BarOur business motto is "come as a guest leave as a friend" which shown clearly from the enthusiastic, warm, friendly and professional Enslish speaking staffs to its defined quality drinks, foods and music surely enhace your urban experiences. Don't hesitate, go out and join us now!Best regards,Le's garden Bar Hue
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Our tour guide took us here and it was fantastic the food was amazing and offered many of the local specialities. They also have western food for children. Happy hour drinks were a real bargain. The special very friendly and explained the menu with much enthusiasm. Also a nice setting set back a bit from the road.
Great HueAsian snacks! Vege cheese spring rolls were tasty. Savory crispy pancake was the best. Friendly staff.

A unique setting which made for a nice atmosphere, staff really friendly and helpful when asked about ingredients. We had the vegetable curry and the (highly recommended ) beef in black pepper sauce as well as flambÃ©ed banana / pineapple for dessert everything was delicious , also cocktails were lovely and at a bargain price, definitely considering a revisit before we leave.

name: Banana Mango
address: 122 Le Loi Phuong Phu Hoi, Hue 531413 Vietnam
description: Our restaurant has airconditioning
example_reviews: Incrediblely delicious meal! Very fresh and lovely presentation. We had soup, spring rolls, crispy noodles, chicken and shrimp. Far better food than we had at the upscale restaurant Sadhu in Hanoi. Kudos to the couple that own Banana Mango. While not centrally located we highly recommend Banana Mango.

Recommended by our guide, this family owned little place, right near our hotel. I'm so glad he did. We had a great lunch; beef pho, crispy noodles with tofu and vegetable stir fry, mango shake and a couple of beverages, all for less than $10 USD and each delicious. The people working there were so friendly and courteous, they easily and graciously absorbed a busload of tourists who swarmed in. Highly recommend!

This is a family run restaurant which has moved location after Covid. We had a gorgeous 4 course set meal for lunch and all the dishes were delicious. The restaurant is a little bit out of the main town but would highly recommend visiting here during your trip to Hue!

name: Tipsy Pub n' Bistro
address: 18 16, Pham Ngu Lao Street, Phu Hoi Ward, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Tipsy Pub n' Bistro was build on the inspiration of good food, good music, and friendly ambient. We mixed our concept is industrial design with a little bit vintage, rustic to bring it into a brand new ambient of chilling place in Hue. About the food, we try to put the fine dining standard to a delicatessen with a high quality of raw materials, and also organic materials. About the music, we played mostly pop; acoustic; pop-rock; and some top hits, after 8:30pm is tropical house, indie dance, and deep house till 1:00am. Besides food and music, we also have a full drinks list from non-alcoholic drinks to beers, cocktails,... with some awesome snacks, and free pool, dart game.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Had caramelised fish with rice, was really tasty Husband had chicken curry which he enjoyed enormously. Food was really reasonable and cocktails cheapest so far in Vietnam. Waitress Chilli was super sweet and friendly. You must go if you are in Hue, Vietnam
Just arrived and this was the first place we ate,ordered the chicken curry it’s was amazing! so much flavour...great inside good vibes also
I had a great time with my friends tonight. Love the food and the ambience. The staff is nice, especially Nan. She is friendly and helpful. I will revisit this place soon 😍😍😍

name: An Nhi Vegan _ Tea _ Coffee Restaurant
address: 07 Phạm Hồng Thái, Phường Vĩnh Ninh, Hue Vietnam
description:
1.392 / 5.000
An Nhi Chay is located right in the center of Hue city, near famous tourist attractions such as the Imperial City and the Perfume River. This convenient location helps the restaurant attract many tourists to enjoy its unique vegetarian dishes.

Entering An Nhi Chay, you will admire the spacious, airy space with a modern design with the main color of white and blue and cleverly decorated, creating a comfortable and close feeling.

The menu at An Nhi Chay is extremely rich, with many diverse vegetarian dishes. The team of chefs here is always creative and updates new recipes to bring diverse and interesting culinary experiences to diners.

Thanks to the skillful combination of fresh ingredients and sophisticated recipes, the dishes at An Nhi Chay always have a unique and different flavor. Diners not only feel the lightness and sophistication of vegetarian cuisine but also enjoy new and unforgettable culinary experiences.

Not only focusing on flavor, the chefs at An Nhi Chay are also very careful in the way they present the dishes. Each dish is meticulously decorated, creating harmony between color, form and content of the dish, bringing a truly enjoyable experience to diners.

An Nhi Chay - Vegetarian Restaurant is a vegetarian culinary destination worth exploring when traveling to Hue. With an impressive space, delicious food, enthusiastic service and beautiful decoration.
cuisines: Late Night Asian Restaurants in Hue
Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
