name: Oasis Bar & Restaurant
address: 42/4 Le Loi Street, Hue Vietnam
description: Enjoy the relaxed ambiance of Oasis Bar. Chill out in our lush beach garden, complete with hammocks and cushions. Its all surrounded by palm trees and plants to keep you cool. Head inside for a refreshing drink, which use quality and fresh in-season ingredients, perfect to accompany a delicious burger. Enjoy a game of pool or a well deserved sit down on our comfy sofas. Let our excellent and friendly staff look after you, while you sit back and relax, surf the net or read a book. It's the perfect way to relax after a long day and wile away the afternoon or evening. Then party with us with Free Shots, Beer Pong, Flip Cup and Western DJ. Buy-One-Get-One_Free Beer, Vodka and Rum Mixers between 6 and 9pm. Then £1 Drinks and $5 Buckets between 9 and 11pm.
cuisines: Seafood Restaurants for Breakfast in Hue
example_reviews: I was in Oasis bar and hostel in Hue and it's such a good experience. It takes you only 3-4 minutes to get to the river bank, 10 minutes (by walking) to Truong Tien Bridge. The most interesting thing is the manager there is a local person so she knows a lot of good and cheap restaurants which you might never knows as a tourism or traveler. She is helpful and friendly. She even offered me free water since she knew that I didn't have a lot of money with me. It's the best choice if you travel alone.

Nice place. Friendly staff. Cheap $5 dorms that are clean and have air-conditioned. The place is quiet and you can relax. The outside area around the house is filled with sand like a beach and you can chill on the hammock. The location is very good, near the river and a small mini-mart
Oasis located in the main street but the price of room so cheap , good service with friendly staffs.I will come back here and will still choose this hostel.

name: Nam Phuong Restaurant
address: 2 Lê Lợi, Vĩnh Ninh, Thành phố Huế, Thừa Thiên Hu Silk Path Grand Hue Hotel, Hue Vietnam
description:
The restaurant offers a magnificent buffet breakfast, with a wide range of dishes and eggs cooked to order. The seating is very comfortable and the staff who are very attentive and polite will arrange a table size to your requirements.

We had dinner one night, sitting by the window overlooking the swimming pool. The food was fantastic, we ordered the Duck with Ginger and Fish Sauce, and it just melted in our mouths.

If you decide to stay at the Silk Path Hotel do yourself a Favour, and dine in at the restaurant, you won't regret it.
cuisines: Late Night European Restaurants in Hue
Late Night French Restaurants in Hue
Italian Restaurants for Large Groups in Hue
example_reviews: The restaurant offers a magnificent buffet breakfast, with a wide range of dishes and eggs cooked to order. The seating is very comfortable and the staff who are very attentive and polite will arrange a table size to your requirements. We had dinner one night, sitting by the window overlooking the swimming pool. The food was fantastic, we ordered the Duck with Ginger and Fish Sauce, and it just melted in our mouths. If you decide to stay at the Silk Path Hotel do yourself a Favour, and dine in at the restaurant, you won't regret it.

This large, hotel restaurant offers an extensive menu of authentic Vietnamese food, with dishes specifically from Hue noted. We tried 2 entrees and found both of them to be absolutely delicious. The service was excellent. The wines were wonderful. The food was outstanding. We enjoyed our meal here and would highly recommend. We also had breakfast here and were very impressed with the extensive buffet, which changed daily. There were so many new things to try, and it was a lovely way to do so -- you only had to take a small portion. The staff here were very attentive and friendly. We really enjoyed our meals in this restaurant and would recommend to friends.

Tan Lam the young chef prepares our breakfast with care. He introduced the various Hue specialties steamed and wrapped in banana leaves, the various condiments to go with the food. The banh mi is the best I have eaten and the Hue version with coriander is delicious

name: Nhà Hàng Nam Châu Hội Quán
address: 04 Kim Long 07 Vạn Xuân, Hue 49000 Vietnam
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
Thai Restaurants for Lunch in Hue

name: Huong Traditional Cakes Restaurant
address: Alley 148 Nguyen Hue, Hue 530000 Vietnam
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue

name: Bánh Ép Gia Di
address: 4 Phùng Chí Kiên, Hue 47000 Vietnam
description: Delicious food, very satisfying. The pressed cake is called à la carte, but the vegetables and dipping sauces served are a buffet. It was quite a nice experience coming here. Especially there are girls who sit and squeeze out cakes publicly in front of the shop, finding it so interesting. The staff are also cute and enthusiastic. A place worth experiencing
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Delicious food, very satisfying. The pressed cake is called à la carte, but the vegetables and dipping sauces served are a buffet. It was quite a nice experience coming here. Especially there are girls who sit and squeeze out cakes publicly in front of the shop, finding it so interesting. The staff are also cute and enthusiastic. A place worth experiencing

The restaurant space is spacious and comfortable, the menu has all kinds of cakes made from eggs, pate, meat, shrimp.... Of course there are free sweet and pickled vegetables. You can enjoy the accompanying dipping sauce (the seasoning sauce is delicious). ) The cake has a lot of filling. Gia Di has a wide variety of dishes from salads, rice paper, etc. Visit Hue and try Gia Di pressed cakes.
the food is excellent, with a special homemade sauce that compliment the dishes very well, staff are very friendly and a very spacious environment

name: Royal Restaurant
address: 51 Le Loi Huong Giang Hotel Resort & Spa, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Royal restaurant is located on ground floor of Huong Giang Hotel Resort & Spa. This is a superb place to contemplate the panorama of the Perfume River and enjoy royal dishes which are decorated sophisticatedly together with the performance of Hue traditional music band will be an unforgettable experience for you.
cuisines: Italian Restaurants for Large Groups in Hue
example_reviews: We were there for a business event and had a very big and tasty buffet. Exiting to try alot of (for me) new and local cuisine, but also some 'classics' available. Good service!

We had a wonderful dinner at this restaurant. You can see the whole city from your table. We expected the meal to be mediocre because it is so cool to be up on the 33rd floor overlooking the city but my calamari was probably the best I have ever eaten. Others in our group had sea bass and it was wonderful as well. The service here was great and restaurant and hotel are really beautiful. I would highly recommend it.

name: La Pines
address: 96 Ming Mang, Hue Vietnam
description: Our restaurant seats 200 people and is open for lunch and dinner, 7 days a week. With both formal dining and more relaxed lounge areas, you can enjoy an extensive banquet or if you prefer, spend an afternoon chilling over a cocktail and bar snacks. We also offer 6 private air-conditioned rooms of various sizes for more private dining, outdoor dining options and a relaxed barbecue area where you can lounge while succulent meats and seafood are cooked before you. Our restaurant specializes in large group bookings and we look forward to serving you soon.
cuisines: American Restaurants for Large Groups in Hue
example_reviews: We hired a car with driver for a trip with our family to the royal tombs around Hue and he brought us to La Pines for lunch when we asked for a good place to eat. The restaurant is clean and the food is very good. Vietnamese food, but also roasted chicken leg (one of the best my son had ever tasted!)

We eat simple noddles with vegetables and rice with egg. It was ok, but nothing to be impressed by. Although the prices are quite high f or what you get. 120d for rice, 150d for noddles. Ordered vietnam coffee and it’s turned out to be just instant nescaffe. Place look nice, clean and the stuff is great.
A short walk from the Pilgrimage Village. Friendly welcome, interesting decor, delicious food (beef noodles, spring rolls, seafood noodles). Recommended.

name: Quán bánh Chi
address: 65 Nguyễn Trãi Hue Historic Citadel, Thuận Hoà, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Traditional heirloom has been served since 1964 (from Hue City, Viet Nam) 1. Beo Cake 2. Loc Cake 3. Nam Cake 4. Ram It Cake Thank you for choosing Quan Banh Chi 1964! We hope you had a great time with us. We would like to take this opportunity to have you feddback, use it to review and improve our services!
example_reviews: We got recommend to come here by our homestay for dinner, so we went and had the platter which had about 5 different dishes with it, for really good value. These are all authentic Hue cuisines and we really enjoyed trying them, my personal favouirte were the Banh Nam. The staff were very friendly and it's very popular with the locals also.
And it was worth trying this place ! We ordered 2 plates of banh beo and they were so delicious that we ate them at lightning fast speed. Place is quiet and staff is nice too, I recommend this place.

We were very grateful to have be recommended this place by our homestay. It has wonderful food, friendly service and an easy location from the Citadel. The staff helped explain how to eat the dishes and the prices were very reasonable. Thank you!

name: Golden Land
address: 36 Doan Nhu Hai Thuy Xuan, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Really good food for a fair price! The owner is really really friendly and thoughtful. Also, he has a really good music taste which is also nice;)
example_reviews: Really good food for a fair price! The owner is really really friendly and thoughtful. Also, he has a really good music taste which is also nice;)
The friendliest staff, and fresh tasty food. Stopped here after looking at the tomb across the road. Needed nourishment to continue our bike ride. If going to Tu Duc Tomb check this place out👍
Doing the rounds and stopped here for an afternoon drink. Ordered caramel frappe . It was awesome- cold and delicious

name: Cay Dao Restaurant
description: Perfect restaurant for the solo traveller. Authetic Hue cuisine at a reasonable price. Friendly hosts, great atmosphere and the meals are very good indeed. Not to be missed.
example_reviews: Perfect restaurant for the solo traveller. Authetic Hue cuisine at a reasonable price. Friendly hosts, great atmosphere and the meals are very good indeed. Not to be missed.
Very good restaurant, the food is delicious, the prices are cheap and the owner is very kind, I recommend!
It’s a little bit hided, but I had here one of the best Vietnamese meal I’ve ever had. Trust me! Ps. Try the hue Omelette!

name: De Men BBQ
address: 46 Ba Trieu, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: We stayed there as a family, the food was great quality and very inexpensive. We ate a bbq, something from the display and a little crawfish. Everything tasted great, especially the numerous sauces and the kimchi were super delicious. The language barriers were overcome with a lot of commitment and translator app. The restaurant is highly recommended.
cuisines: French Restaurants with Private Dining in Hue
Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: We stayed there as a family, the food was great quality and very inexpensive. We ate a bbq, something from the display and a little crawfish. Everything tasted great, especially the numerous sauces and the kimchi were super delicious. The language barriers were overcome with a lot of commitment and translator app. The restaurant is highly recommended.

Some 15 minutes on foot from the Vincom Plaza we stumbled across this place, that's actually an open to street, covered food hall off one of the main roads. We were nearly the only tourists this week-night and came to experience a local place with freshly grilled delicacies. Basically, you choose from an array of skewers with fresh and raw bits of wonderful chicken, beef, fish, shrimp, frog ... (with or without vegetables) placed on dishes in a stall in the center of the hall. All platters have the price per item listed next to them so you know exactly what you pay for what you get. These chosen skewers (or whole pieces of fish and bird) are marked in a roster at your table along with the beers or drinks you get from the refrigerator at the back of the hall. You get a basket pp with slices of fresh cucumber and some big faboulos raw green leaves you can just graze upon) and can also order sides (rice, vegetables ...). While sipping your drink and watching locals your choice of food gets BBQed on a grill in the back of the hall and will be brought to you to enjoy shortly along with three hot delicious sauces. We repeated the 'choose & enjoy' process three times and had a big, delicious, authentic meal complete with slurping, finger licking, pointing and not understanding what they say. Because it's very basic and simple it's not expensive, so you get the fresh pieces of your choice cooked fast and brought hot to your table, Go. Enjoy. Don't fuss. Repeat. Daily.

Best meal in Vietnam so far. Waitress so helpful using translate on phone app. Cold drinks tender bbq pork. Noodles so tasty and Enoki mushroom dishes delicious superb service highly recommend. So far hue favourite city. Started north heading down to ho chi min.

name: Hue Jade Restaurant
address: 43 Hung Vuong, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Welcome to the hue jade restaurant! Located in the heart of the city on hung vuong road, our restaurant offers you a huge variety of tasty authentic vietnamese dishes, including hue specialities, for both lunch and dinner.
example_reviews: We stayed a week at Jade hotel and each morning had a wonderful breakfast and we were always greeted with a warm smile from Hang and all the breakfast staff. The food was delicious and fresh everyday. Hang and the rest of the staff were so kind and friendly and sincere. They made us truly feel like family. Very professional and always there to answer questions or to have a pleasant conversation. I highly recommend this restaurant if you’re in Hue and also jade hotel is highly recommended.
Delicious food. Very warm and friendly staff who are happy to have a conversation with you. Such a great day to start the day.

Hang and the team gave excellent service for our 4 night stay. The choice of 4 fresh fruits, choice of eggs and Vietnamese breakfast was really good. Each day we were asked if we wanted to order some more food. For our boat trip on the Perfume River, Hang advised us against buying lunch on the boat and instead gave us a pack-up of hard boiled eggs, bread and bananas. This comes into the “exceeding our expectations” category. On our last night we decided to eat at the Jade Restaurant and the suggested set meal was very tasty, with good portions and dishes we had not eaten in other places.

name: Hoa Vien
address: 11 Vo Thi Sau Str, Hue Vietnam
description:
Our tour group had a dinner here, after a busy day around Hue.  We had a wonderful meal with 6 courses. 
Service was excellent and the food was great with fresh spices and ingredients.
The only down side was that it got very crowded and became a little noisy- but to be expected with a good family restaurant.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Our tour group had a dinner here, after a busy day around Hue. We had a wonderful meal with 6 courses. Service was excellent and the food was great with fresh spices and ingredients. The only down side was that it got very crowded and became a little noisy- but to be expected with a good family restaurant.
Had lunch at the Vegetarian Hoa Vien as part of an organised tour. Prompt service from the staff & delicious food, which was plentiful. Pleasant ambiance.
Hv a great food and dishes. Wifi also provided. A clean and fast service from their staff. Really enjoy our lunch here

name: Ushi Restaurant
address: 42 Pham Ngu Lao St, Hue Vietnam
description: Ushi restaurant is located at the central of Hue city. we serve many Vietname and Westen foods. Especially, our best seller is: caramel chicken, noodles, curries, beefburger and bratwust.With our friendly and helpful staffs, you will be satify when you come to our restaurant.we open from 7am to 11pm.During nearly 20 years, we always try our best to make customers happy.Comming our restaurant like at your home.
example_reviews: Typical local menu served up by the family who run this place with smiles and happy nature. Good size portions and very tasty, if you want it more spicy just ask.
Stopped in to Ushi for something light. I ordered the Papaya Salad. It was a good portion and very tasty. I could have had it spicier, I’m used to the papaya salad in Thailand but it was good.
Had a good meal for a reasonable orice. The staff is friendly. Pitty that there wasn’t a tune playing. Caramalized chicken is nice.

name: Donald Trung
address: 14 Le Minh, Hue Vietnam
description:
This place is full of the Hue locals at the best pork place in town. Roast and delicious with pancakes. Go to the central station and help yourself to a host of greens. Pour out a bowl of the fish sauce and peanut. Whack chilli paste  into the fish sauce. Roll up the pork. Get your google translate out and eat the best pork in Hue. 
If you need cleanliness and calm prolly not for you but if you want a viet experience for pork this is the only
Place in town. 
Banh Trong cuon is the crispy number - take the top
Option
Banh uot I loved - again pancakes
Bun nam mem - crackling good pork on dry noodles which I sorted out with some fish sauce and peanut sauce. 
Get involved.
example_reviews: This place is full of the Hue locals at the best pork place in town. Roast and delicious with pancakes. Go to the central station and help yourself to a host of greens. Pour out a bowl of the fish sauce and peanut. Whack chilli paste into the fish sauce. Roll up the pork. Get your google translate out and eat the best pork in Hue. If you need cleanliness and calm prolly not for you but if you want a viet experience for pork this is the only Place in town. Banh Trong cuon is the crispy number - take the top Option Banh uot I loved - again pancakes Bun nam mem - crackling good pork on dry noodles which I sorted out with some fish sauce and peanut sauce. Get involved.

If it’s authentic crispy pork belly you’re after this is the place. Download google translate before you otherwise it’s just point at what you want! Chaotic restaurant. Not the cleanest but quite delicious. We were the only tourists in there. Well worth a visit!

I came home wanting pizza for dinner, but my wife had bought home some take out food from Donald Trung. I resigned myself to the fact that we were not having pizza. However, the pork dishes were very tasty, there was a smelly sauce for the pork and rice cakes, but the dish that really impressed me was the Chao Bo. So tasty, and the beef just fell apart in my mouth. My wife says the customer service is really good. I plan on going there for lunch tomorrow for more chao bo and to see if the service is that good. It won't matter, as long as the soup is still awesome.

name: Nhi's Crepe & Pizza
address: 9/25 Hai Bà Trưng, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Fresh, hot and delicous! Come and enjoy the defference!
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: We craved some pizza and searched online for a nice place. We came across Nhi’s Pizza & Crepe and decided to give it a try. Definitely worth it! Very friendly staff and they made me a pizza without mozzarella (because of a lactose intolerance) and it was so tasty. The dough is really crispy and everything seemed super fresh. 10/10 recommended if you’re craving a pizza in Hué.

Tucked away in a lane way (Ket 25, Hai Ba Trung) just behind the Cinestar is a little place called Nhi's Crepe & Pizza, which is without a doubt one of the best keeped local secrets that only a few tourists know about that I have come across. Although I have not yet tried the crepes the pizza is by far, one of the best pizza places in Hue City. The freshness of the ingredients and the combination of flavours makes you wanting more. With it's friendly staff, curious locals and it's quite unassuming location is hidden and little gem, a must visit on any tourist or locals Hue's must do list. If you are looking for a great pizza and have time to go out of your way stop into Nhi's Crepe & Pizza for the taste of western culture that even the Italian's would find it hard to match. This not a paid post, I genuinely found this place on Google and am glade I came here.

So I went here with my family and it was so nice. Delicious food/drinks(I had margarita pizza + pineapple juice but my sister got a hazelnut crepe with strawberry and banana and she said that was delicious too). Staff was friendly and nice!

name: Fruit House
address: 32 Dinh Tien Hoang, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Thank you very much for giving me the chance to talk about my favourite restaurant. The name of my favourite restaurant is FRUIT HOUSE (FAST FOOD, HOT POT, VEGETERIAN AND JUICE) and it’s situated in the centre place of the city. I like the serene environment, serves and tasty food. The price is reasonable and food is served quickly. Although space is small but very cozy and stylish, staffs are good and friendly.
cuisines: French Restaurants with Private Dining in Hue
Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: The fried noodle with egg was delicious and for a good price! The restaurant is right next to the Imperial City and the lady who owns the place is very nice and smiley. They also provide free WiFi, I would come here to eat again!
The host is very friendly and food are delicious. We ordered two dishes and they are both great. The price is not expensive
Nice little restaurant with a friendly host. Dishes were very delicious. A small but good selection of vegetarian food is available too! Recommended!

name: Hung Vuong Inn
address: 20 D Hung Vuong, Hue Vietnam
description:
Great location, nice staff and a wonderful menu of a mix between East and West.
When in Hue, twice a year, I eat here 2 or 3 times a week and have done so for the past 5 years.  The food is reasonably priced and always tasty and I am slowly eating my way through the whole menu.  It is also a great place to meet other western tourists and chat about their stay in Hue as well as meeting locals who obviously know a great place to eat.  Easy walking distance from most hotels in Hue and easy to find in Hung Vuong Street.
cuisines: Italian Restaurants with Buffet in Hue
Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Great location, nice staff and a wonderful menu of a mix between East and West. When in Hue, twice a year, I eat here 2 or 3 times a week and have done so for the past 5 years. The food is reasonably priced and always tasty and I am slowly eating my way through the whole menu. It is also a great place to meet other western tourists and chat about their stay in Hue as well as meeting locals who obviously know a great place to eat. Easy walking distance from most hotels in Hue and easy to find in Hung Vuong Street.
Great staff, very good food, may not be traditional Vietnamese architecture, but it's clean and pleasant.
Centrally located restaurant with large choice of Vietnamese and European food and drinks. The food is well prepared against reasonable prices. English speaking staff.

name: 054 Cafe'
address: 35 Nguyen Cong Tru, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Awesome and relaxed bar off the main strip in Hue. Relaxed vibe, good drinks and great staff. Pool is free too!
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Awesome and relaxed bar off the main strip in Hue. Relaxed vibe, good drinks and great staff. Pool is free too!
Not full of tourists. Amazing staff. Cheap beers. Great music. What else can you want?! Great vibe, great staff l, great atmosphere, can't reccomed it highly enough.
Friendly staff, great music, good food and cheap beer and pool tables and it's open late! What's not to love?

name: Di Nhien Tea House
address: 26/3 Nguyen Thien Thuat, Hue City Thuan Hoa, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Just some steps from the Imperial city, Di Nhien Tea House is a cosy and peaceful corner for local people and travelers who want to discover the authentic and traditional Vietnamese culture, or just to relax after a long time of working or traveling around Hue. Di Nhien offers not only traditional tea but also other drinks and Vietnamese specialities ("banh khao","com lang Vong",...)
example_reviews: This is my second time visiting this place. There is a variety of tea for customers to choose. I love the aroma and the tastes of these teas. The waiters are well-informed and shared with us a lot about Hue culture and tea culture. Worth a visit!!!

I came to Di Nhiên tea house through the introduction of a Hue native friend. Gratifying experience. In the cold winter air and heavy rain all day, Di Nhiên space's warmth and the great tea taste really impressed me. With the attentive service and good tea knowledge of the tea waiter here, I am really satisfied. Reasonable prices are also a strong point of the tea house. I will come back to Di Nhien again when I come to Hue next time.

A very peaceful and pleasant place, and the tea (which is collected by the owners) is some of the best I've ever tasted. Very kind staff. We left with several teas as presents for our friends back home.

name: Koi Coffee
address: 20/19 Nguyen Thai Hoc, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: We have a beautiful koi aquarium over 110 koi fish. Airy space and right in the center of Hue city
example_reviews: This place is wierd. Dont get me wrong they do great coffee's. Went here three times and all times got different size coffee's. All were large take away. One day a small next day a large then a medium but all for the same price. Maybe they ran out of take away cups or maybe thought westerners let's ripped them off!!! When your craving a coffee give them a go!!
Wow this place have a great koi lake. My friend love that fist. So in another time i'll come back here. Thx so much

For all of people who want to work in a nice and relaxing atmosphere, koi coffee is a perfect location ! The WiFi works perfectly, the juice is excellent and the team is very friendly. I want two times during my stay, they prepared the meal according to my preferences and it was delicious. Thank you again to the team and the owner for their kindness :)

name: La Brasserie & Le Bar
address: 105A Hung Vuong street, Phu Hoi ward 1st Floor, Indochine Palace, Hue city, Vietnam, Hue 084234 Vietnam
description: The “La Brasserie” is a full service dining restaurant serving breakfast, lunch and dinner. The elegant hotel’s signature restaurant is overlooking the pool and landscaped gardens; the pleasant ambience reflects the architectural design of the Hotel. The Brasserie features a display kitchen in the centre of the restaurant.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Sufficient cuisines to ensure that any international traveller could eat familiar food from home. Should concentrate more on indigenous Vietnamien food Appetisers and mains arrived at the same time- I would order sequentially next time to ensure gaps between courses

After another busy day we were just too tired to go into town to try “authentic” Vietnamese food so decided to dine in our hotel. A first class meal without doubt Vietnamese and served in a comfortable setting only an elevator’s ride to the land of nod. Subtle flavours, attentive and helpful staff who suggested one of the side dishes I was going to order wasn’t the best choice to go with my main course makes such a difference rather than let the customer be always right only for them to believe their choices were ill matched when it’s too late, after the meal. A definite one to recommend.

We went there 6 friends to drink something... But the cakes and ice cream cought our eyes. We went in the evening so there was some live classical music playing. Was really nice and delicious. The service was fast and the staff make sure that we won't need to "search" for someone if we need something and was always try to keep in eye contact. Thank you guys for a nice evening.

name: Pho Nuong Tokyo BBQ
address: 13 Vo Thi Sau, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: TOKYO BBQ restaurant have 3 floors Floor 1: Street food and local food Floor 2 : Sea food Floor 3: BBQ Japanese food ( Grill at the table )
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: you can order different menu the meat and fish is backed on a bbq in the middle of the table at the inside of a restaurant located in a mall meat quality was medium quiet some fat meat good for a one time experience with our son
We had a very nice lunch after a long morning walking and discovering the city. Service was good, food was okay. I recommend it if you’re hungry and want something to eat quick and good

Amazing food and super service. I have been eating my fair amount of Korean BBQ in China and I will rate this higher than any of the places I have tried in Suzhou(Jiangsu) and Shanghai. The personell is super friendly and over all a great experience, totally recommend it if you are in Hue! @Mr.Thanh is a champ

name: Hoang Anh
address: 140 Kim Long T.p., Hue Vietnam
description: We have been pleasantly “stuck“ in Hue for two months because of the pandemic. We live 1 km from this place and decided to give it a try. The food was great and service was fast. They don’t speak English but there are only two menu items to choose from. We went with the “bun thịt nướng” at one USD each. It was well seasoned and delicious. Some Westerners might like it because it is not highly seasoned but is complex of ingredients. We will definitely return. Best time to go is lunch or no later than 8pm.
example_reviews: We have been pleasantly “stuck“ in Hue for two months because of the pandemic. We live 1 km from this place and decided to give it a try. The food was great and service was fast. They don’t speak English but there are only two menu items to choose from. We went with the “bun thịt nướng” at one USD each. It was well seasoned and delicious. Some Westerners might like it because it is not highly seasoned but is complex of ingredients. We will definitely return. Best time to go is lunch or no later than 8pm.

We came here with our family while visiting the three tombs near Hue. Our driver recommended this because we wanted to eat local food. The price is clear, there is not really a menu. The food was simply superb. First fresh spring rolls. Add two types of sauce. Then noodles with meat and vegetables/salad. Local beer, lemon juice, cold green tea. I can't describe how much everyone enjoyed it. But trust me, it's worth a visit!! Absolutely recommended. Driver ordered food by the way, so not sure if they speak English.
My taxi driver recommended this place to me. The food is very good and very cheap. it's very close to Thien Mu Pagoda as well. They don't have a big menu but what they offered was tasty.

name: Royal Park, Hue
address: 38-43 Nguyen Sinh Sac Street, Vi Da, Hue, Hue Vietnam
description: We are a group of 13 photographers and we visited Hue in July 2012 on a self managed trip.  We engaged the services of a driver to take us around.  He took us to Royal  Park restaurant in Hue for lunch. Upon sitting down, the caption told us that they only serve set meal and was reluctant to let us order ala carte.  First he told us that the set lunch for each person is 300,000 dongs.    We then asked him to show us how the meal look like.  He was unable to show it and merely showed us the list of dishes which numbered about 9.  When we said the set meal was too expensive, he reluctant reduced it to 250,000 dong.  It was equivalent to USD 12.5   We we told that each person will be given a set of meal each.  However to our great shock, the dishes were shared with 4 persons and the portion were very small.  I believe we were taken for a ride and I would like to advise all tourist who travel on their own not to patronise thsi restaurant.
example_reviews: We had a fixed menu meal here. The restaurant was fine, food was good. The street (actually an alley) was off-putting because of the construction work being carried out. This, however, did not interfere with a nice evening with a very nice dinner.

Wanted to repay new friend for his hospitality whilst in Hue. Asked concierge where would he go for dinner... afterwards, I could see why he recommended it... it was out of his league.. sounded and was EXPENSIVE...therefore presumed that the meal was commensurate with the price! I, on returning afterwards filled him in as to his advice... I don't think that he will repeat his faux par again! A 12 course banquet fit for royalty.. VD, 137,000 for 1/2, ... 750.000 ( for 5+) I could spend a long long critique on (my opinion) on the meal that was put down or 6 people. But I won't waste too much of your valuable reading time, by boring you with the same old, same old.... if a king was to eat it, after the first coupla dishes... they wouldn't. Be around !! Fare: king Dragon of appetizers .. a ballotine of sweetn sour pickle encased withovercooked force meat.. it was so dry/ overcooked, I couldn't work out what it was. A selection of 4 was on the plate.. all were overcooked and dry, and cold! A chicken n vege soup... an over boiled (dry) fish n vege soup: .. a dry and coarse minced pork n crab meat stuffed in a crab shell n deep fried... etc etc... what the???? Served to royalty???? I could go around a few Street cafes , choose the equivalent dish, and they would not be any worse!!!!but cheaper!!l I am sure that Vietnamese cuisine is better than what we were presented with... even the porkfried rice(?), a dish so so simple... was butchered...were the cooks on strike , and the door man took over?. It appeared so!! The only thing that was up to scratch was the Private room, the accompanying musicians/ singers( I don't speak Vietnamese.. so no savvy).. the wait staff service! A Chilean Red at Vn. 515,000.. and 6 x VnD 750,000 , was very very expensive meal! I remembered paying more at Hanoi a coupla years ago( intercontinental hotel). But.. there was no complaints??? I don't like to review / rate Restaurants, etc negatively , but, this is in my humble opinion, and my knowledge of food, Icall it as I eat!!! Remember, I was only trying to repay my gracious host /friend in Hue for his hospitality. I am embarrassed by the result, I paid the money..the restaurant pocketed it, I was left with ???? Rate. Food... 3.5/10 Service... 8/18 Value. 3/10 Return for 2 nds... would you???

We were steered to Royal Park by our hotel concierge when we requested an 'Imperial Meal.' The restaurant is in an out-of-the-way location and had a number of tour buses parked outside - never a good sign, in my experience. I had the vegetarian option while my friend had the regular Imperial Meal. Neither was very good. Most things were deep fried, and perhaps not even that recently. After I finally asked the waiter (who was trying hard and seemed to be a good guy) whether there was anything NOT fried, I was brought some steamed vegetables and then a plate of noodles with vegetables. The 'dessert' was 3 small pieces of fruit and a very tiny round cake. The meal cost 500,000 dong EACH (about $23 U.S.), which is a very high price for what we received. (By comparison, we ate lunch at a vegetarian restaurant and paid the equivalent of $10 for about 6 dishes!) I'm about to write my review of the hotel, which we liked a lot, but they're losing a star for sending us to this place.

name: Hue Hostel & Sports Bar
address: 10 Pham Ngu Lao Phu Hoi, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Located right in the heart of Hue's Backpacker district, we are the first dedicated sports bar in town. We cater to any and all international sport, AFL, NRL, NFL, NBA, NHL, EPL.... you name it! We are open from 6:30am - 11pm everyday and focus on the essentials, cold beer and pub food at a reasonable price. We also have nightly events, games and pub quizzes so there is always something exciting!
cuisines: Italian Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Great venue in a quiet town. Hosts Nathan and Eddie make everyone more than welcome. Drinks are cold, cheap and moreish. Good atmosphere and also cheap, good food available at pretty much anytime. Pop in and they will welcome you at the door. Accommodation also available, I am told clean, cheap and great for all backpackers. Give it a try, you won’t be disappointed!

Seems like a great place to chill out. Peoples are friendly bartenders take well care and are fluent in English (which seems common in that area) their payment possibility seems funny at first but as it’s a hostel too it makes absolutely sense... so if you want to chill out meet some backpacker it’s the deal ;-) where else you get toilet and shower the same time
We had dinner here and it was terrible. We ordered a meat lovers pizza but could not eat it. The spring rolls were ok, but the onion rings were also bad. Okay place for a drink but not food

name: Anh Kafe
address: 5 Nguyen Hue Street, Vinh Ninh Ward, Hue Vietnam
description:
I love everything is this cafeteria. I ordered peach macchiato and unfortunately, I poured all of the cup before I had a taste. However, the waiter quickly came and clean up the mess I made. After a while, he came back with a new cup of peach macchiato and said that this is a free gift from the coffee shop and wished me a nice day! What a kind treatment!
Highly recommend this coffee shop for everyone!
example_reviews: I love everything is this cafeteria. I ordered peach macchiato and unfortunately, I poured all of the cup before I had a taste. However, the waiter quickly came and clean up the mess I made. After a while, he came back with a new cup of peach macchiato and said that this is a free gift from the coffee shop and wished me a nice day! What a kind treatment! Highly recommend this coffee shop for everyone!

We went to ANH KAFE in the afternoon when walking on Nguyen Hue Street (add:5 Nguyen Hue str). Nice decoration, quiet space on 2nd floor. We were introduced to macchiato tea very tasty. Must try tiramisu (sold out when we arrived), Orange Mousse Cake, Profiterole ,. Extremely friendly staff, he helped us use paper cups, and always said thank you. Thanks for a beautiful memories in Hue !
Excellent coffee with delicious deserts and kind stuff. Great place for a short break :) I also like the minimal design here.

name: Com Nieu Gia Dinh 2
address: 26 Ben Nghe, Hue Vietnam
description: Our driver brought us here, mainly because the owner spoke English. The food was good for locals and this place was full when we arrived. The quality of the food was acceptable although not as good as other more expensive restaurant. We had crispy chicken, Pho, spring rolls and roast pork.
example_reviews: Our driver brought us here, mainly because the owner spoke English. The food was good for locals and this place was full when we arrived. The quality of the food was acceptable although not as good as other more expensive restaurant. We had crispy chicken, Pho, spring rolls and roast pork.
Gad mackrel clay pot style. One small piece of fish,some rice , tomato and cucumber. Also had a papaya juice. All for about $6 Australian. 100k dong

Ordered the fried chicken and rice to go. The chicken was perfectly crispy, and served with a small scoop of rice, a couple slices of tomato and cucumber and fish sauce. I was satisfied with the taste but looking through the menu I noticed the prices are relatively high compared to most other Vietnamese restaurants. But this means I paid $3 instead of $1 so not outrageous or anything.

name: Hoa Nghiem Vegetarian Restaurant
address: 28 Ba Trieu, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description:
If you are a Vegetarian you must try.
If you are not a Vegetarian you must go there too. You will be blown away. You might reconsider your choice to eat meat. We started with the pumpkin soup. Outstanding. We had the mango salad, clay pot meat with salt and pepper. Grilled tofu with chili and lemongrass in piper leaves. (similar to grape leaves)
Ask for a local favorite other than what we listed here. It is very easy to try many different dishes as they are priced less than a dollar to about 2 dollars. We left, sampling several choices and beer, with a bill of only $13. Totally full, totally happy! This is a must stop when you are in the City of Hue, Vietnam
example_reviews: If you are a Vegetarian you must try. If you are not a Vegetarian you must go there too. You will be blown away. You might reconsider your choice to eat meat. We started with the pumpkin soup. Outstanding. We had the mango salad, clay pot meat with salt and pepper. Grilled tofu with chili and lemongrass in piper leaves. (similar to grape leaves) Ask for a local favorite other than what we listed here. It is very easy to try many different dishes as they are priced less than a dollar to about 2 dollars. We left, sampling several choices and beer, with a bill of only $13. Totally full, totally happy! This is a must stop when you are in the City of Hue, Vietnam

This place is a hidden gem!! Ms Ha greeted us with a warm smile. Even though we were the only people for dinner, she gave us enough time to choose food, got us the jasmine tea, made us feel so welcome. The food was just amazing with lots of variety and distinctly tasting, flavourful dishes. It's hard to find a place that offers such kind of fresh and delectable vegetarian food. The restaurant is also very neat and clean. Our best wishes to this place, we hope it grows more popular and continues to offer such great vegetarian food. Special thanks to Ms Ha for her hospitality and care.

Great, reasonably priced vegan meal in Huê. Servers Duc and Y were very friendly and accommodating from the start and we were given some complimentary snacks while we waited for our food. There’s an extensive range of food and drinks on the menu.

name: Nhà Hàng Gongwuan Hotpot
address: 14 BẾN NGHÉ, Hue 55000 Vietnam
description: A hot pot restaurant with Chinese flavors is considered the best in Hue that I have used. With beautiful and harmonious decor. Especially the service staff are very enthusiastic and support my family at all times. This is a dining spot that everyone should come and experience.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: A hot pot restaurant with Chinese flavors is considered the best in Hue that I have used. With beautiful and harmonious decor. Especially the service staff are very enthusiastic and support my family at all times. This is a dining spot that everyone should come and experience.
A great experience. The very attentive service employee explained the procedure perfectly to us. The ingredients were excellent and we really enjoyed it.

name: Morning Glory Hue - Local Restaurant
address: 44 Đoàn Nhữ Hải, Thủy Xuân, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description:
This place is amazing! We just wanted something to fill our bellies after visiting Tu Duc Tonb

But then we saw this menu and ordered a lot! The prices are very good and it's a good way to try local food without any doubt about hygiene.

The staff are super friendly and show you how to eat the dishes properly at your table.
example_reviews: This place is amazing! We just wanted something to fill our bellies after visiting Tu Duc Tonb But then we saw this menu and ordered a lot! The prices are very good and it's a good way to try local food without any doubt about hygiene. The staff are super friendly and show you how to eat the dishes properly at your table.

Exactly opposite the entrance to the Tomb of Tự Đức. Cute little place, run by a kind and smiling lady. Local food, freshly cooked, excellent quality! To try absolutely: - Bahn Nam; - Bahn Loc; - springrolls (these are served in a special way, with vegetables aside: try them!!!). PS: we happened at 17.30, at the closing time of the monument, when there is no more trace of tourists: priceless atmosphere, at sunset! Grazie Morning Glory Hue!!!

Small, but with the owner extremely nice and sympathetic lady and with very good local food! Strategic and convenient location, right near the entrance to the monumental site. Excellent dry noodles with shrimp! Good service and acceptable prices!

name: Stop & Eat - Family restaurant
address: 49 Le Loi street, Hue Vietnam
description: Dear Traveller, Welcome to Stop and Eat , a local family restaurant, established in 2015, the restaurant is centrally located near the Truong Tien Bridge and The Perfume River. For the adventurous travellers you can stroll from your hotel or for those not yet familiar with the streets of Hue, simply jump into a Taxi. We serve local Vietnamese cuisine and are well known for our signature Hue Banan
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Best taste and excellent quality, you should try once as you will cherish the taste forever. The quantity is also good
I had an excellent fried rice with shrimps at this place. Friendly staff and quick service. Nothing to complain about
The local food here was good. The pho was particularly tasty. The local drinks were also refreshing. The service was very polite.

name: MÃ©w Secret
address: 35 VÃµ Thá»‹ SÃ¡u Phá»‘ TÃ¢y, Hue 52000 Vietnam
description: MÃ‰W Secret is created from reflections on classical values â€‹â€‹amid modern, hustle and bustle life. Where there are coffee cups, bitter cocktails on the tip of the tongue but sweet aftertaste.
example_reviews: The staff tried but this was not a great experience. The alarm bells started ringing when we learned that the fried rice dishes in the menu were unavailable. Some spring rolls arrived fairly soon, but we then waited 30 minutes for ten bbq shrimp. The balcony is a cool space and if you are only looking for drinks then it might work out. But based on tonight, food is not their strength.

This is a great spot to enjoy some cocktails/beer & food while looking out over the Hue Night Walking St. we sat upstairs and had a great view of the band on a balcony. Food was fantastic, service was great. They even serve 1L cocktails for those who want a bigger serve. Great cocktail selection.

We really enjoyed the cocktails and peanuts on the first night so came back the following night but only to be thoroughly disappointed. Not by the cocktails themself or the service but their advertising of happy hour, 2 drinks for 1. We had 6 cocktails thinking we would pay for 3 but were were given 3 vodka Red Bull as the â€˜freeâ€™ cocktail but didnâ€™t realise until we got the bill. We walked away very disappointed.

name: Cam On Cafe
address: 52 Chu Van An,, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Very nice egg coffee and cake. Absolute joy. We were there on holiday and had an after dinner coffee. Please visit them when you can.
example_reviews: Very nice egg coffee and cake. Absolute joy. We were there on holiday and had an after dinner coffee. Please visit them when you can.

name: Nha Hang Chay Phuong Nam
address: 142/2 Nguyen Sinh Cung Vy Da Ward, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: The fruit shake drinks really are wonderful. We came back here 5 times before we had to leave Huế, it was that good! And such a good price! We pretty much had everything on the menu and all were good. The stand outs were the watermelon and banana/mango shakes. Amazing pho and wonderful guava salad. The corn salad (which was ok) is a warm, not a cold salad. Note: the restaurant will relocate to the owner’s place (“ Ly’s House” in a month or two. She has asked me to post the map here - see picture below.
cuisines: Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: The fruit shake drinks really are wonderful. We came back here 5 times before we had to leave Huế, it was that good! And such a good price! We pretty much had everything on the menu and all were good. The stand outs were the watermelon and banana/mango shakes. Amazing pho and wonderful guava salad. The corn salad (which was ok) is a warm, not a cold salad. Note: the restaurant will relocate to the owner’s place (“ Ly’s House” in a month or two. She has asked me to post the map here - see picture below.
Delicious food, great hosts, very resonable prices and a lovely decor! Once we found it, we just kept coming back
We had several Vietnamese dishes at this place. The quality is excellent and the staff is very nice!

name: Rumba Restaurant
address: 50A Hùng Vương Melia Vinpearl Huế, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: THE BEST BREAKFAST IN TOWN with a superb selection of the freshest ingredients, Rumba restaurant offers a buffet-style breakfast experience to enjoy Vietnamese, Asian and Western cuisine.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Regardless what you like for breakfast they got it and it s the best quality. Amazing spread, amazing staff.

Efficient welcome service. If you are tired of walking around the city in the constant rain, this restaurant offers a varied menu including dishes, among other things, typically Vietnamese. The dishes ordered were very good.

name: The Rustic Kitchen & Chill Bar
address: 46 Pham Ngu Lao, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description:
Ate here on the last night in Hue after we stumbled upon the ‘tourist’ area. 

Great cocktails (£3 and they were on offer at £1.50) and the lovely local food starting for £2.50 per plate. Bargain!

One thing you need to get used to, they Vietnamese people don’t have a concept of starters then main courses, whatever you order can come at anytime so be prepared.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Ate here on the last night in Hue after we stumbled upon the ‘tourist’ area. Great cocktails (£3 and they were on offer at £1.50) and the lovely local food starting for £2.50 per plate. Bargain! One thing you need to get used to, they Vietnamese people don’t have a concept of starters then main courses, whatever you order can come at anytime so be prepared.
On the way back from drinks we stopped for a glass of Italian shutdowns wine. Great service and a nice view of young people going for for the next 10 beers
Great cozy place with surprisingly good experienced servers. Food was good but not excellent. The entire atmosphere invites you in. Give it a try.

name: Dong Tam Bakery
address: 122 Le Loi Phu Hoi Ward, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Đong Tam bakery is located in 122 Le Loi street. We are very proud of giving a fast food, deliciouss and safe for all guest. you can enjoy many kinds of cakes from our bakery such as: grapes cakes, coconut cakes, suger cakes,batiso, socolate cakes...for sorf meal, or bread, sweeet or grapes sanwich for breakfast, luch or dinner...
example_reviews: WE had the very popular Vietnamese sandwich Bahn mi. I got it with pork, you can have chicken , fish, or vegetarian. Bahn mi is the Vietnamese name for bread. In addition to the meat, there is cilantro, cucumber,pickled carrots, pickled daikon, pate, along with jalapeno and mayonnaise. It cost $.50 american. What a deal.

name: Song Huong Floating Restaurant
address: Feb03 Park Le Loi Street, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Had potential just never reached it. We were only ones in restaurant at 4.30pm so early but no one else around asked for table outside on top deck many tables were set up but they put us at a table not set up. Took a long time to get drinks , although whilst waiting there was a rat scuttling around who seemed quite friendly and didn’t bother us lol, staff hadn’t seen it. At least it showed the restaurant wasn’t going to sink lol. Food arrived then it started raining si were moved down one floor - had sweet and sour pork flavour was lovely pity the pork was full of bones and barely any meat on it pretty inedible but veges nice. Fiancé had beef stir fry which was ok beef chewy flavour ok. Rice was over cooked which was suprising in Vietnam. Also had fish and chips starter which was ok althooogh chips dry and not very nice. Ordered a cocktail Pina Colada was not cold and just tasted like alcohol. The place seemed set up for special occasions but very dated and a lot of staff but all very young. Advice not going here was 700000 nzd $47 for two mains and entree and 3 drinks , so yeah sure cheap by NZ standards but from what else we have had in Vietnam expensive for awful food.   Place could be amazing but unf run down and dated and slow service.
cuisines: Late Night Italian Restaurants in Hue

Place could be amazing but unf run down and dated and slow service.

Nice view with the river and all, but the service was terrible. We just wanted to sit down and get some drinks. We ended up waiting 30 min to get our drinks even though the restaurant were not that busy ( + the drinks was overpriced compared to size and quality). When we wanted to pay the bill, we waited over 15 min after talking to a waiter before they came with the bill. Overall bad service.

Thought I’d have my last evening meal in Hue on the Son Hương. I’d had a daytime beer to escape the heat on it a few days ago & the menu looked decent enough. I couldn’t fault the ambience but the food & service was very disappointing to say the least. I was advised that my choice would take 35 minutes but it turned up 10 minutes later & was cold. I already had my table placing whipped away from me prior to my meal being served & when I complained about the meal I was met with a half hearted apology.

name: Banh Mi Op la
address: Alley 33, Le Quy Don Street, Phu Hoi Ward, Hue Vietnam
description: This place is pretty local hiding in the alley. No other travelers while we eating. We ordered steak with eggs and cup of coffee. Taste is great. Word of advance: better learn a little bit vietnamese before you go as the locals may not understand english.
example_reviews: This place is pretty local hiding in the alley. No other travelers while we eating. We ordered steak with eggs and cup of coffee. Taste is great. Word of advance: better learn a little bit vietnamese before you go as the locals may not understand english.

In America it is very hard to find this dish as well as in Vietnam. My friend Tony took us here for breakfast and after coming to Vietnam 3 times now this is still my favorite breakfast I’ve had. The sauce they cook the egg and meat in was so delicious when dipping the baguette in. The sauce also goes superb with the meat and egg adding a wonderful flavor.
I have been there since 2008 and when i came back this July, the taste was still good. You can choose variety dishes for your breakfast as steak, egg or chicken.

name: Pumpkin Bistro & Restaurant
address: Duong Vo Thi Sau 53, Hue Vietnam
description: Absolutely fabulous food here - traditional Vietnamese, cheap prices. Perfect for our last meal in Hue. Can not recommend this highly enough. Half the price of the flavourless meal we had the night before at a ‘touristy’ restaurant
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Absolutely fabulous food here - traditional Vietnamese, cheap prices. Perfect for our last meal in Hue. Can not recommend this highly enough. Half the price of the flavourless meal we had the night before at a ‘touristy’ restaurant

Charming little restaurant at the bottom of a dead end in Hue that offers excellent dishes very well cooked by a young very talented chef who also gives cooking lessons. Very sweet price for quality. Also recommended for the reception.

Amazing place, food is delicious and people are really nice! You can eat a 100% homemade food and take a cooking class. I had a great time learning how to cook Hué pancakes, Fried Spring rolls and chicken with lemongrass. You must try

name: King’s Panorama Bar
address: 16th Floor, 08 Hung Vuong Imperial Hotel Hue, Phu Hoi, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: We saw the bar from the floating restaurant and decided to visit on 13th Feb 2023. You can simply walk into the Imperial hotel (which has very nice lobby) and take lift to 16th floor. On a warm evening it was magical with the city lit up at night. Cocktails were $6 and fine and good service by our waitress. The bar offers a selection of light meals so fine for lunch too. We were the only people there and the upper 17th floor is occupied by bonsai a small temple with traditional wooden tables overlooking  koi pond (This bit is amazing). This is a real undiscovered gem and the only 'at height' outside bar/restaurant in Hue so we were baffled why it wasn't packed with people but guess few westerners post Covid. It was the same on 14th Feb when we returned for Restaurant (see that review) but suggest stick to bar to avoid disappointment in restaurant.  We can't comment on the Imperial Hotel rooms (which were quite reasonable on internet) as we stayed at Pilgramige Village near out of town near Tombs.
cuisines: Asian Restaurants for Large Groups in Hue
Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue

I visited this rooftop bar (the Imperial Hotel) for a drink. You can sit outside or inside and have a marvelous view of the city. If the weather is good, I recommend sitting outside. You can see the river and the Citadel and it is wonderful to see the lights come on. You have an amazing view of the French Bridge (built by Eiffel) and this bridge lights in a dramatic way in the evening. This is a great place to relax and have a drink.

name: Viet Village Restaurant Cafe
address: 21/33 Nguyen Cong Tru, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: This hideaway on the water is a must when in Hue. Food was fantastic in this undercover open air restaurant. Lots of choices in local food to munch into. Washing down with your favorite beverage.
cuisines: French Restaurants with Private Dining in Hue
Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: This hideaway on the water is a must when in Hue. Food was fantastic in this undercover open air restaurant. Lots of choices in local food to munch into. Washing down with your favorite beverage.
Excellent choice for a local family style meal. We had 16 people for dinner, service was efficient, the staff was very friendly, the food was delicious, and the beer was cheap.
Take a walk down the lane toward the river.... Food, service and view are all spectacular... One of the best in Hue and certainly reasonably priced.... 5stars from the children too..

name: 1995s Hub Rooftop Bar
address: 16 Chu Van An Phu Hoi Ward, Hue 49000 Vietnam
description: "Enjoy stunning sunsets at our rooftop bistro, serving delectable Western cuisine, beautiful cocktails, and refreshing beer. Experience the best spot in town." Feel free to add more specific details or amenities if you'd like! This should create an inviting and memorable impression for your guests.
example_reviews: We visited the newly opened sky bar; the view was so beautiful as we watched the sunset above the bustle of the street. The service was super, super friendly, all the staff made us feel welcome! We tried the delicious spring rolls and were very impressed, I could have eaten 50 of them. We had a couple of drinks that were well priced and served with great care. Thank you for the lovely evening 10/10

name: Om Pub & Restauran Hue
address: 82 Le loi Street, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: My restaurant is beautiful and my staff is very lovely and friendly.. :))))
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Was pleasantly surprised to find such good Mexican food in the middle of Vietnam for a wee break from the local stuff. Staff were lovely and the beef nachos were top notch.

Well, at this restaurant, the quality of the food is good and the price is very cheap. Most importantly, the service is very good, them attitude are very friendly and enthusiastic. I like it. I'll comeback

We tried this little restaurant as we fancied a change from Vietnamese food. Had great drinks and the food was lovely. We had soft tacos that were delicious. They make a mean mojito too. Great service and great price.

name: Nhà Hàng Chay Huế An - Vegan Restaurant
address: 1/109 Minh Mang Street, Hue 49000 Vietnam
description:
Amazing food and served with lots of passion and love..

Everything was just tasty and specially the spring rolls we loveeed it..

Great food ,service ambience.. nothing goes wrong

Be here if you are around

name: Madame Chau Restaurant & Bar
address: 29 Tran Quang Khai, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Located on the first floor of Alba Spa Hotel, Madame Chau Restaurant & Bar offers a range of delectable dishes all day. The daily breakfast buffer will take you on a culinary journey with choices of local dishes as well as Western delights.
cuisines: Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: I ate in this restaurant three times while I stayed at the Alba Spa Hotel. Every time I had a meal here the staff were attentive, friendly and professional. The chef is a very good chef, the food was always very good quality, presented beautifully and cooked to perfection. There is a lot of dishes to choose from on the menu and very reasonably priced. The Vietnamese food was very tasty and I tried something from the Western element (the loin pork with mustard sauce) and that too was tasty and a lovely meal. Pineapple flambé for dessert was delicious. I recommend this restaurant highly.
We had 7 different traditional Vietnamese dishes - it was very nice, very busy so you will need to book
After our busy morning tour we decided to eat at the restaurant in our hotel before going back out, and what a great decision that was. Our food was nicely presented and tasted absolutely delicious.

name: Pause Coffee
address: 69 Vo Thi Sau, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: We had smoothies , coconut coffee and a mango grilled sandwich as recommended by the staff. They were presented beautifully and rated AMAZING! Would highly recommend. So reasonable pricewise aswell.
cuisines: Seafood Restaurants for Breakfast in Hue
example_reviews: We had smoothies , coconut coffee and a mango grilled sandwich as recommended by the staff. They were presented beautifully and rated AMAZING! Would highly recommend. So reasonable pricewise aswell.
Good coffee for westerners. We enjoyed our flat whites and cold coconut coffee. Nice relaxed atmosphere too.

We spotted this place whilst having lunch opposite and decided to pop in for a coffee. Really nice place with a relaxed atmosphere and friendly service. We ordered two coconut coffees and they were the best coffees we had during our time in Vietnam, highly recommend!

name: Huong Cau Restaurant
address: No 4 Nguyen Binh Khiem Street, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Huong Cau restaurant business about Hue local special foods. Come with us, you can enjoy tradition foods: Banh Beo, Banh Nam, Banh Loc, Banh Khoai, Cha Tom..with cooking methods was really specie. Restaurant is family restaurant style. You can feel hygiene, safe and was serverd thoughtful. Mrs Hong who owner was invited many time to guide" How to make local food "on Vietnam Television.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: The best place to eat banh hoi I've ever eaten. The wait was a bit long but extremely worth it. Banh nam is also delicious. I don't understand why this delicious restaurant has so few customers. Shrimp is very fresh. I went to Hanh restaurant (very crowded), went to a few other restaurants but this restaurant is the one I was most satisfied with.

A small restaurant, hidden in a not touristic area, with local food, managed by a great and very friendly family. You can choose in between a la carte menu or (as recommended by them and also by us) a set of typical Hue dishes. Especially the "banh beo" was absolutely delicious, definitely recommended! After the lunch they were so kind to help us also with some directions and advices for the city: wonderful! The younger part of the staff speaks English: you must try this place!

We got this place recommended by our tour guide when we asked him to tell us where he would go for dinner with his family. He arranged as well the menu for us as the members of the family that run the restaurant are speking no english. The local Hué food was delicious. We ate all the Hué-dishes that were displayed on the menu except the Pho. Highly recommendable if you are looking for a place with authentic and local Hué food.

name: Garlic & Chives Restaurant
address: 02 Vo Thi Sau street, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Located in the heart of Hue at 02 Vo Thi Sau Street, Garlic & Chives Restaurant invites you to experience an extensive fusion of Western and traditional Vietnamese cuisine along with a great selection of wines, cocktails, and beers. Our highly trained professional chefs prepare this unique cuisine daily with special attention to detail at all levels. While at our restaurant, you will be served by a team of professional and friendly staff dedicated to serving both newcomers and locals. In addition to our exciting menu, we have a variety of daily promotions and free wifi. Private dining rooms, air-conditioned rooms, special holiday or party reservations, and other services are also available. ​
cuisines: Seafood Restaurants for Breakfast in Hue
example_reviews: As tired travelers with children we came upon Garlic & Chives and were so delighted. The food was excellent and staff were so accommodating to our large group which included three kids. They sat us upstairs with air conditioning as they could tell we were hot and and the food was very good. I definitely recommend this restaurant.
Garlic and Chives is a small family run restaurant with a wonderful menu. The food is delicious and very ethnic. Staff is helpful and speak English. Highly recommended.

The environment of the restaurant was very warm and welcoming. Not only was the food incredible, but the service was amazing as well. The waiter was extremely kind and patient with my family and I didn't have to wait long for my food to come out. I would highly recommend this restaurant to everyone and I'm definitely coming back soon!!

name: Vinh Lac Tran
address: 23 Chu Van An Phu Hoi, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: When we first got there it was almost empty, so we chose a place and got a menu and drinks. But not long after we were there the place began to fill up. They started pumping what I think was dry ice out into the street. And it started to get very loud with the music and all the people. By the time we left it was completely full and people were waiting to get a table. Wow, it was a very popular place with the locals and was very noisy.
cuisines: Late Night French Restaurants in Hue
Italian Restaurants for Large Groups in Hue

Great choice of good food. Seafood, seashells, shrimps, frogs, meat. The waiters are a little bit chaotic and speak small English. Very nice location.

Me and friend accidentally found this palace since there were the boy at the gates that spoke English fluently. Rare occasion, by our opinion. Nonetheless, food were docent and we didn’t have anything too negative to say regards that. But looks like it is hard to get someone to explain you what we ordered or what get any good recommendation. Prices are modest as well. From outside, this restaurant looks fabulous. If we could only eat by looking.

name: Quan Nho
address: 28 Pham Hong Thai, Hue Vietnam
description: This small food store is a typical of restaurant in Vietnam, where you can get the best street food at the cheapest price. I usually choose this kind of restaurant on my journey to save my money:)
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: This small food store is a typical of restaurant in Vietnam, where you can get the best street food at the cheapest price. I usually choose this kind of restaurant on my journey to save my money:)

Order Com Hen (top thing on the menu on the wall) add a little of the shrimp paste and a healthy dose of chili. Thank me later. Too strong of a flavor for many westerners, but if you can hack it... this is a taste and texture extravaganza!!

name: Century Pub Beer Garden
address: 49 Le Loi Street, Hue Vietnam
description:
If the wind is in the right direction you can probably hear the music in Hanoi!

Technopop with a male and female DJ taking turns at the helm.

A lively crowd of all ages.

I found it irresistible and went back a few times but can understand why it might not be to everyone's taste.

As it is very open you can stand outside and observe what's going and decide whether you want to in or not.
example_reviews: If the wind is in the right direction you can probably hear the music in Hanoi! Technopop with a male and female DJ taking turns at the helm. A lively crowd of all ages. I found it irresistible and went back a few times but can understand why it might not be to everyone's taste. As it is very open you can stand outside and observe what's going and decide whether you want to in or not.

This place was massive! We arrived around 10pm and there was a DJ. Although the bar wasn’t full there were enough people to have an atmosphere. It looked fairly boring in the day time but was a great place to go in the night if you are looking for a bit of fun.

This place is very conveniently located in the central district of Hue. Not a great place if you're looking for gourmet food but perfect if you're looking for late night hunger-killing bar food. PERFECT if you are looking to socialize, grab a few beers, and listen to some amazing music from around the world. Staff is very friendly, DJs are awesome, and you will not leave disappointed. Drinks are priced very affordably, and so sticker shock is not much of a pain. A MUST-DO for all travelers in the central Hue area that are looking for some down time and relaxation!

name: Sakura Sushi Garden
address: 76 Nguyễn Huệ, Hue 530000 Vietnam

name: Green Bean Restaurant
address: 57/3 Nguyen Cong Tru street, Hue Vietnam
description: We are proud to introduce to you the richness of Vietnamese culture through the many traditional dishes my immigrant mother still prepares at home. We offer the freshest ingredients possible, in order to enhance the taste of our dishes as they should be prepared. Specialty dishes may change seasonally so that we may feature and purchase local produce and meats.
cuisines: American Restaurants for Large Groups in Hue
example_reviews: The cake is vey delicious and the design is beautiful Having a lot of kinds of drinks to choose in the menu

The restaurant is located in a small alley, attached to the Serene shining hotel. Google threw up some reviews of the place and they didn't disappoint. Vietnamese food can seem a bit unfamiliar if you haven't lived in SE Asia and you need a helping hand. That's where they came in. Katie & Ivy were very helpful - they helped us with recommendations from the menu and patiently answered all our questions about the food.
Great services ... All staff were very approachable, sincere and genuinely warm. Vivian, the manager was friendly and chatted with us and Made sure our orders were ok. Love the breakfast menu.

name: Old Money Cafe & Cocktails
address: 26 kiệt 64 Nguyễn Công Trứ Thông kiệt 41 Nguyễn Thái Học, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Cocktails bar: 17h45pm-24h. Hidden bar in Hue. Add: 25/64 Nguyen Cong Tru (Hue-Viet Nam) Time: 17h45-24h Tel: +84777469955
cuisines: Italian Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: We were so lucky to have been recommended Old Money when we arrived in Hue looking for somewhere for a drink... this is genuinely one of the best bars I've been in (and I travel a lot)...unless you've been told where to go, you'd miss it... hence the clientele is mainly locals... firstly the cocktails are sensational, the staff are incredibly welcoming and knowledgable, add to that the soft jazz soundtrack and you start to sense the atmosphere... We were only in Hue three nights but we made sure to return to end our stay... we checked with the owner to ask whether he was happy for us to share his secret as we didn't want to spoil it for the locals... he has an inclusive vision... he wants everyone to enjoy Hue and his wonderful cocktail bar... so please, don't miss this wonderful gem ...

name: The Temple Restaurant Hue
address: 5 Chu Văn An Phú Hội, Hue Vietnam
description: The restaurant is located on the pedestrian street in the city center, close to tourist attractions, train station, hotels, ... with a variety of dishes, suitable for domestic and foreign tourists.
cuisines: Seafood Restaurants for Breakfast in Hue
example_reviews: The restaurant is big and that makes it cooler inside on a hot day and has plenty of fans. Nice ambience. We had four meals here for good food and convenience. The chef came out to discuss a dish with us and later came to see if we enjoyed it. The menu offers plenty of choice - descriptions are in Vietnamese, French and English. Service is with a smile and excellent. Liked that the first thing we were given upon being seated was a cool, wet towel. Bathrooms available too.

I happened to pass by and saw a beautiful restaurant so I stopped in to try some spaghetti. The noodles are fragrant with butter and the sauce is very delicious. If I have a chance, I will stop by again!

name: Ba Hoa
address: Truong Dinh st, Hue Vietnam
description: We wanted to try Com Hen as recommended as a Hue specialty and oh my it was so delicious! A fantastic clam broth with delicious stir fried baby basket clams, noodles, vegetables and roast peanuts. It tasted rich and flavoursome. The service was friendly and helpful and very inexpensive.
cuisines: Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: We wanted to try Com Hen as recommended as a Hue specialty and oh my it was so delicious! A fantastic clam broth with delicious stir fried baby basket clams, noodles, vegetables and roast peanuts. It tasted rich and flavoursome. The service was friendly and helpful and very inexpensive.

Aloha, We were recommended this place by Saigon Morin Hotel just around the corner. It was so good. The space level was great. Found myself wolfing it down and had to slow down. The folks were very nice to us. We also had Bun Hen and Bun Bo Hue, all good. And always cold Huda Beer. This is a repeat on the next visit. Mahalo

name: Hue Riverside Resort and Spa
address: 588 Bui Thi Xuan Street Thuy Bieu District, Hue 053000 Vietnam
description: Stayed here for three days, everything was great, especially the rooms with riverview and a bath. Beds were very comfortable. Breakfast was good and plenty.
cuisines: Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Stayed here for three days, everything was great, especially the rooms with riverview and a bath. Beds were very comfortable. Breakfast was good and plenty.
Wonderful place with friendly helpful staff, food was excellent and room was very clean. A peaceful place.
The hotel is located at the perfume river and offers the perfect getaway from hectic city life. Very friendly staff and nice, clean rooms. Breakfast buffet is very good.

name: Hue Spring Bar-Restaurant
address: 64 Le Loi, Hue Vietnam
description: Tonight we had dinner in the Hue Spring Bar-Restaurant. We ordered the Beef-Curry for both of us. It took 30 minutes and it was okay but too expansive for that manue. The sandwiches on the other tables looked good. And the service seemed to be not really motivated and we had to wave all the time...
cuisines: Late Night French Restaurants in Hue
Italian Restaurants for Large Groups in Hue
example_reviews: Tonight we had dinner in the Hue Spring Bar-Restaurant. We ordered the Beef-Curry for both of us. It took 30 minutes and it was okay but too expansive for that manue. The sandwiches on the other tables looked good. And the service seemed to be not really motivated and we had to wave all the time...

Had dinner here tonight and it was above average, nothing great but enough to get a pass. Friendly staff who are attentive. We had spring rolls, calamari and 2 pork dishes. The missus had the meal of the night, it was grilled pork with BBQ sauce. The calamari came battered, I was expecting crumbed, so I guess that's on me for not asking. The calamari itself was ok, but the rings were pretty small under the batter. I had the local pork dish with rice, it was a little too chewy for me and the fat attached to it definitely needed to be cooked longer as to make it not just taste like fat. Total cost of meal was $19 AUD, so not too bad. Give it a try, I guess it's like most places, can be hit and miss depending on what you order.

We had a lovely dinner here. The staff were very attentive, maybe they read the last review and have made efforts to improve as we couldn't fault them. The food was delicious, we had the local specialities, they also have an extensive western menu (which we avoided). It wasn't the cheapest place we've eaten but was under 500k for family of 4 including drinks. I'd happily go again.

name: Son Hai Restaurant
address: 135 Minh Mang, Hue 53000 Vietnam
description: - Authentic Vietnamese cuisine - Perfect Brunch & Dinner - Cozy Atmosphere - Spacious space with indoor air-conditioned rooms and extended patio area
cuisines: American Restaurants for Large Groups in Hue

name: Ruby Bistro Restaurant
address: 17 Nguyen Thai Hoc, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Our restaurant is located in the heart of Hue city, near Perfume river & walking street. Our restaurant is opend from 7 am to 12 pm daily
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: I was greeted like an old friend when I arrived at Ruby Bistro. The hostess and owner Thinh and her staff were so helpful and friendly and showed me straight to my room. There was a slight problem with the sink and they had no hesitation in offering me an alternative room. The bed was comfortable , room simple but great for 250,000 vnd per night and the shower nice and hot. The food here is outstanding . I recommend razor clams in garlic which were sublime . The location is central to the backpacking scene and quite lively at night .Don't expect a very quiet stay. That said I slept like a log.
