name: Barapub Beer Garden
address: 11 Le Loi, Hue 53000 Vietnam
description: #giant jenga #pool table #soccer table #dart #festive music #coldbeer #BBQ #Porkribs #Beef #Cocktails #Hue # Vietnam
example_reviews: Go and try the bacon cheese and eggs sandwich!!! It's very tasty and great quality streetfood what the guys made. I had to order a second one!

I was delighted to find this little street side cafe on my evening walk. PEACE sits on a quiet stretch of sidewalk in front of Huong Giang Travel on Le Loi just west of the entrance to the ancient, riverside Walking Street. Food is all cooked to order by friendly, eager-to-please staff. The fare is light.....hot sandwiches, burgers and crepes. Beer is served cold and with lots of ice. Can’t beat the price either. I live here, so I’ll come back often!

What's a tasty hamberger! It's only 1 dollar. Staffs are very cute! The location is easy to find, located on the sidewalk and very cool . After eating, you can go to the "walking street by night" near by 600 meters.

name: Tinh Quan
address: 9 Ngo Quyen Street Vinh Ninh Ward, Hue City, Hue Vietnam
description: We visited this restaurant 3 times for dinner during our stay in Hue and never ran out of delicious food options! Lots of vegan options. Very low cost for large servings of food! Great service and knowledgeable staff. Lovely Vietnamese cuisine. Would recommend to anyone!
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: We visited this restaurant 3 times for dinner during our stay in Hue and never ran out of delicious food options! Lots of vegan options. Very low cost for large servings of food! Great service and knowledgeable staff. Lovely Vietnamese cuisine. Would recommend to anyone!

This clean, cool restaurant is found at the back of Park View Hotel. The menu with pictures and English translation is easy to navigate. Enjoyed the thick slurpy mango juice (bit on the sweet side) followed by main course of braised jack fruits and steamed rice. Highly recommended, good food of good value.

Amazing vegetarian food for very cheap prices. Service is also very good and the dining area itself is very comfortable. We had tofu sauteed with mushrooms and wheat gluten (sometimes known as seitan) fried with vegetables. Absolutely delicious!

name: Nha 87 Coffee
address: 87 Le Huan Thuan Hoa, Hue 530000 Vietnam
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue

name: Pizza Amour
address: 21 Lê Quý Đôn Phú hội, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Very good pizza! Very cheap! We are here with 4 persons, pizza drinks and dessert for about 15 euro. Quality was very good
example_reviews: Very good pizza! Very cheap! We are here with 4 persons, pizza drinks and dessert for about 15 euro. Quality was very good

Average pizzas, i think they might have sugar in the dough, which was different from what i am used to, so maybe not a bad thing, just different. Good smoothies! The menu is not quite clear on whats on the pizzas, like the description on pizza Hawaii is "Five-O" and there are more examples like that, gave me a good laugh while reading the menu though!

We went to try out Pizza Amour our first night in Hue because we were located just down the street. The food was ok. The Japanese noodle with fried soy was simply spaghetti with fried tofu in a sweet tomato sauce. The pizza was small and the cheese (margarita) came with olives and red peppers which is a little out of the ordinary. It too was ok. The deserts (we tried almost all) were ok, with the crepe with lemon taking the win for best dish of the night. As for the service, if you guessed ok, then good job! The staff were friendly enough. After being seated upstairs though, we were pretty well ignored once our food was brought to us. We had to go back down to order desserts and drinks. The price, although cheap, is reflected in the portion size, making it ok. Altogether once was enough and we didn't return. We wouldn't recommend it as there's better places nearby.

name: Bigben Coffee - Restaurant
address: 40 Nguyen Tri Phuong, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description:
This is a friendly family restaurant. The cook is so good I gave him my prescription sun glasses! The waitress is prompt and friendly with very good English.
The food is authentic Vietnamese and the beer is cold.
Budget priced and a convenient location.
I was a solo traveller from Canada and ate there frequently. Wished I could be there now.
Spent a pleasant evening during a flood drinking beer with endless gratis peanuts and visiting during the last night in the city
cuisines: Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: This is a friendly family restaurant. The cook is so good I gave him my prescription sun glasses! The waitress is prompt and friendly with very good English. The food is authentic Vietnamese and the beer is cold. Budget priced and a convenient location. I was a solo traveller from Canada and ate there frequently. Wished I could be there now. Spent a pleasant evening during a flood drinking beer with endless gratis peanuts and visiting during the last night in the city

Stumbled across this place when we first arrived in Hue. The food is really cheap and tasty. I would really recommend the pork and veg crispy noodles, some of the best I've had. Service was good, this is a no frills place with awesome food

Went there for dinner and it was full so the staff brought table for us from somewhere on the back. It was busy but waitress took our order quickly and we didn't wait too long for the food. We had pancake with pork and shrimp and pork skewers with rice paper to DIY. Everything was very tasty. Definitely recommend this place.

name: Hue Plumeria Restaurant
address: 30/42 Nguyen Cong Tru Street, Hue Vietnam
description: Opening from 7:00 am to 22:00 pm Local restaurant with real local food Traditional food with friendly service from local people Restaurant with air conditioning Quiet location with nice to talk with local family Vietnam local food with local price The restaurant with nice view & design.it will bring more comfortable for the guests when they stay here
cuisines: Seafood Restaurants for Breakfast in Hue
example_reviews: On our third day in Hue and just changed accomodation so very close to here. Found Vietnam very disappointing so far outside of Hanoi for food cheap eats. We enjoy a fried rice type of lunch, cheap and fills us up until dinner. Walked passed here after deliberating at a few menus and decided to go in. Completely empty but bearing in mind it’s only 1pm on a Thursday and Hue seems fairly quiet compared to other places we have travelled in the last 6 weeks. I got the chicken fried rice and very happy, well seasoned and tasty. My boyfriend got the pork and shrimp pankcake and thoroughly enjoyed it. Well priced and tasty food. We don’t really expect much in the terms of “service” whilst in Asia, we are backpacking and on a budget, a saved €2 is colossal to us. Service wasn’t bad despite saying that.
The food was excellent and the staff was so warm and welcomingm Haooy hour, all kinds of discounts and free fruit platters. Ambient sounds and fishes swimming around. Would go again.

We went here after a recommendation from our hotel for a lunch, and even had dinner the day after because it was that good. It was without a doubt the best Vietnamese food we had in Vietnam! Try the chicken with lemongrass, shrimps in garlic and the fresh spring rolls. You will not regret it! Very good quality for the price. Besides: if you go now, you have a chance of seeing the two 4 weekold puppy's, who are adorable. Big thumps up!

name: Victory Bar
address: 07 Pham Ngu Lao, Hue Vietnam
description: Not sure, but I went into the Victory Bar for a drink and noticed that I kind of got curious looks. When inside, I noticed that there was nothing but young Vietnamese men there and half were in some kind of uniform. I am not gay, but I have been to gay bars with gay friends and this appeared to be one. No big deal......just prefer women.
cuisines: Late Night French Restaurants in Hue
Italian Restaurants for Large Groups in Hue

The bar is so funny, i have 2 night in here. I think it is the good place to come in Hue. The service is friendly. Good.

I 've been there twice or maybe three times one year ago, but i never feel comfortable with that pub. All the guys inside made me crazy and really horrible. And music, too. Not at all, but some guys from their staff were really really really RUDE ! Say never with Victory ! Never.

name: Truong Tien Cafe & Restaurant
address: Chuong Duong Chuong Duong, Truong Tien Bridge, Hue Vietnam
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue

name: Pho Nui Restaurant
address: 18 Doan Nhu Hai Thuy Xuan, Hue Vietnam
description: Three of my old war buddies and I left Hoi An on a long, all-day tour. Our guide took us here for a late lunch. The food was excellent and the service was quick. It was a pleasant break from our interesting but hectic tour. I wouldn't suggest you fly across the Pacific Ocean just to have lunch here, but if you happen to be in the area, you should give it a try.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue

Very friendly service. Traditional vietnamese cuisine, along with local beer, made for a wonderful lunch. Good value for money. Highly recommend!!!!!

name: Quang Aachener Imbiss
address: 149 Ba Trieu Xuan Phu, Hue Vietnam
description: A unique Hue specialty restaurant where you can try the tasty Banh Khoai (Hue rice pancake). Also should try their duck dishes as those are really good. The duck meat is tender and moist. Owner is super nice as well.
example_reviews: A unique Hue specialty restaurant where you can try the tasty Banh Khoai (Hue rice pancake). Also should try their duck dishes as those are really good. The duck meat is tender and moist. Owner is super nice as well.
Im already one month in Hue and I needed to find place like this :) Really friendly sfaff, speaking deutsch also. Really good values prices :)

name: Bun Bo Hue My Tam
address: 5 Tran Cao Van, Hue Vietnam
description:
We went there for the famous Bun Bo Hue, but we were not expecting this at all and the meat inside was questionable... 
But what made us regret our dinner is that they made us pay twice the price we should have payed, just because we are tourists... They are thief!
cuisines: Late Night Asian Restaurants in Hue
example_reviews: We went there for the famous Bun Bo Hue, but we were not expecting this at all and the meat inside was questionable... But what made us regret our dinner is that they made us pay twice the price we should have payed, just because we are tourists... They are thief!

Bun Bo Hue is one of the defining foods of Hue and this is the place to have it. Just show up at the corner restaurant and you will be shown a seat. No need to struggle with a menu, the hearty soup will just be placed in front of you with a bowl of seasoning herbs to add as you wish. Delicious.

name: Pizza HT
address: 2/140 Nguyen Hue, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Here, we use all the best ingredients in order to make a perfect pizza... delicious, fresh and hot.
example_reviews: Almost the best place to have a pizza in Hue! Highly recommended to tourists who try to taste some Italian food here

name: Rose 2
address: 02 Chu Van An St, Hue City, Hue Vietnam
description: Wouldn't go back. Small servings and the 'hot pot' is tiny. Search on TA for somewhere better. Atmosphere was good though.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Wouldn't go back. Small servings and the 'hot pot' is tiny. Search on TA for somewhere better. Atmosphere was good though.
Good food. Wide range of options on the menu. Service was great and speaks good English. Nothing to complain about.
Friendly service. Quick. Seemed fairly busy out the front with locals which is a nice touch. Food was quick and good. Reasonable prices. Would recommend but certainly not good enough to return

name: Anh Cookery
address: 3/11 Võ Thị Sáu, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Anh Cookery inspire foodies to authentic and traditional Vietnamese food. Anh Cookery is a small local business with passion from local chef to bring foodies all over the world taste flavorful Vietnamese cuisine with love.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: If you're looking for an authentic, wholesome and delicious cooking experience I would highly recommend Anh's Cookery! We were graciously invited into Anh's family's home to cook three typical dishes from Hue (the secret food capital of Vietnam). Apart from the delicious food, our highlight was the genuine and interesting conversations we had with Anh. He was a really great chef and cool person!

Anyone who visits the food capital that is Hue, is 100% missing out if they don’t take this class. Such a great experience with a very skilled chef. Learned plenty about food, culture and technique and the food was nothing short of absolutely delicious. Anh is also incredibly knowledgeable and has always been more than helpful in answering any questions we had. Great experience over all! In short: Highly recommended and an absolute must-do for anyone visiting Hue!:-)

We're really happy we found Anh's Cookery, it was exactly what we wanted in a cooking class and would highly recommend it. Anh speaks fantastic English and is very personable and talkative. He will pick you up from your hotel and go straight to the market where you can ask him any questions you might have about Hue food and culture as you peruse the vendors. Then he takes you back to his lovely kitchen in a peaceful but central neighborhood in Downtown Hue. There you prepare the food, drink tea and chat about anything and everything. Anh teaches you some practical cooking skills and shows you how to make a variety of dishes. We especially liked the green mango salad and BBQ with homemade peanut sauce. By the end of it we were stuffed and ready for a nap! Overall, highly recommend. We learned how to make some nice Hue dishes and loved Anh's family and kitchen. It was a relaxing, fun experience.

name: Khói Mô
address: 13 Ra Đàng, Nam Đông, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description:
Amazing…
I came here once in December 2024 after exploring Kazan Waterfall. The restaurant’s food impressed us: grilled chicken, crispy pork fat. I will come back to support the restaurant if I have the chance to visit Hue.
Thank you for the unique durian dish
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue

name: Nha Hang Thang Long Hue
address: 22 Dien Phai, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Thang Long city tour company is located in the heart of Hue city, one of companies is leading to organize inbound and outbound tour programs in Hue city. besides, Thang Long city tour company has 1 hotel names City tour Hotel with 25 city view rooms with a lots of supported services and Thang Long city tour restaurant which have just moved to a new site with modern equipment, fresh, airy space ,can contain up to 500 persons.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: As this is a tour bus place, don't expect haute cuisine. However, the food was very good and plentiful. The drinks are reasonably priced and the service quick and friendly.

We had eaten here 2 meals with my Students group I think the food was good, but it's not fit for north person, the food was sweet and spciy, First day we aet Frist Floor and Second day we aet Second floor, I think Reasonable price 100VND for 1 pack.

I had a chance to have lunch at this restaurant during my city tour in Hue. Its architecture looks gentle. The best thing, for me, is the friendliness of the staff. They were helpful to give more interesting about the dishes we chose. A nice restaurant!

name: Mama's House Hue
address: 11 Nguyen Cong Tru, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Western and vietnamese cuisine.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Very tasty food! and very friendly and smart staff. They were helping us a lot. And made some discounts or compliments. So thankful to them! And hello to everyone. your friends from Russia, Gektor and Karina.

My husband and I have come here to eat a couple times and the food has been great! The first time, we ordered a 35cm pizza which was NOT 35cm..it was only 25cm (we measured it with a ruler because we were shocked that it was 35cm.. turns out it wasn’t). We asked about the size and it turns out they don’t even make 35cm pizzas because their oven can’t fit a pizza that big.. now that the issue has been addressed, I believe they’ve covered the 35cm option and only serve 25cm. The pizza was one of the better pizzas we’ve had—the crust was crunchy (not soft/mushy/doughy like almost all other places we’ve tried) which was just perfect for us. The second time we ate here we had a burger, which was hands down one of the BEST burgers we’ve eaten in Vietnam! Their burgers seem to be double patties so they are pretty filling, but well worth ordering. Stacked high and topped with melty cheese and fresh garnishes and a small side of fries, the burgers look like they’re straight out of a magazine ..and taste even better! The menu is far too big, however, and their marketing is so so so confusing. They call themselves a burger house but also have pizza, pasta, Vietnamese food, fried chicken, crepes.... if they cleaned up their marketing and served just burgers and lowered their prices, they’d make a killing and would probably jump from #153 to the top 20 or better on the ratings.

We had an awesome dinner here, super good food with amazing flavours for an affordable price. Definitely recommended when in Hue.I also was impressed by the friendly staff , especially the manager on duty, Mrs. Ny (Nhi, i don't remember ) always be smile and take care us. I didn't know that it has the hotel, too.

name: Nam Phuong Restaurant
address: 12/1 Alley 33, Nguyen Cong Tru Street, Hue Vietnam
description:
We were here for dinner. We ordered a baguette with minced meat with French fries and coleslaw and the Pho with chicken. The baguette was rather tasteless, the French fries and coleslaw very good. The Pho was excellent, good broth, lots of chicken, vegetables and herbs. Both were reasonably priced. For drinks we had a can of local Huda beer, good for 50k dong(2€).
A small bottle of water, the Italian brand Panna was an absurd 129k dong(5€).
Very friendly service.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue

The baguette was rather tasteless, the French fries and coleslaw very good. The Pho was excellent, good broth, lots of chicken, vegetables and herbs. Both were reasonably priced. For drinks we had a can of local Huda beer, good for 50k dong(2€). A small bottle of water, the Italian brand Panna was an absurd 129k dong(5€). Very friendly service.

This is the Nam Phuong hotel restaurant at the Silk Path Hotel in Hue. The food was simply terrific. Very refined, beautifully presented, attentive service. Our favorite dish was the duck sautéed with ginger — amazing! The restaurant itself is simply gorgeous. This meal was the highlight of our 10 days in Vietnam.

You have to look for this place as it is hiding down an alley. Once you arrive, you'll be surprised how large of a space it is. A nice open setting. Service was great even though they didn't speak English (French is spoken though). I enjoyed my meal of vegetables and noodles and a smoothy.

name: Be Kem - Banh Trang Kep
address: 29 Ngo Gia Tu, Hue Vietnam
description: Banh Trang Kep is a popular Vietnamese street snack known for its crispy texture and flavorful toppings. It’s usually grilled with ingredients like egg, dried beef, and green onions, then served with a tasty dipping sauce. Affordable and delicious, it’s a must-try for street food lovers.

description: Looking for a romantic space at sunset or a silent night in an ancient city? Looking for a peaceful night view of Hue from above? Ben Thanh Cafe is an ideal place for your choice of cocktail or beer after a long day of discovery. We will make your evening so meaningful and unforgettable that you will want to return often. cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: As vegetarians traveling in Vietnam, we were eager to try the local food, but also wary it may not be completely vegetarian.. this place had A nice variety of Vietnamese dishes, everything we tried was tasty, the staff were helpful and friendly. In short: simple, delicious, good value
Everything else was average...the service was fair, price reasonable, fans worked....they also served Huda beer ðŸ˜€
good excellent with frieds. enjoy the food, maybe have a beer? but aftera beer dont drive. respectã€€the law.

name: All Risotto Restaurant
address: 69A Võ Thị Sáu, Hue 53000 Vietnam
description:
The  food was fabulous, with a combination of Italian and a  Vietnamese menu. The restaurant  also provided free appetiser of bruschetta, (so good) , a soft drink or beer and some fruit after our mains.
The waitress Huong was welcoming, polite and attentive  which enhanced our first night experience , in Walking Street in  Hue.
I would recommend this restaurant to anyone travelling in Hue.

Really nice staff and the service is great. The coconut icecream is to die for, really delicious! The food came quick. They had some happy hour deals also for the food.

name: Shanti Craft Beer And Coffee
address: 04 Võ Thị Sáu , phường Phú Hội Nhà hàng nằm ngay trung tâm thành phố Huế, trung tâm phố đi bộ cho du khách., Hue Vietnam
description:
We visited and it was a blast. The owner speaks excellent english, he told us about coffee in the region, he knows his stuff :)
They have a nice selection of craft beer, but also have some local lagers at a cheap price. The tomato and basil beef stew we tried was one of our favourite dishes we had on our trip!
And of course, by far the best salted coffee we've had :)

Lovely place with a good selection of international and local beers. Also, super friendly service with staff speaking English very well.
The beef noodle stew was incredible! Best food we’ve had in Vietnam. The salt coffee was also delicious, we had never tried this before but would definitely have again.

name: 75Dope CAFE'
address: 35 Nguyễn Công Trứ Phú Hội, Hue 49000 Vietnam
description: We have Cocktails, Beer, Cofffee, Foods and some game to play. Hiphop music and Art.
example_reviews: I sent my husband and 16 yo son in to kill time while I got haircuts for the other 2, I wish I’d sent my husband for the cuts so I could have more time to chill here! Free pool and the awesome guy working spent half an hour or more playing pool with our 12 yo and teaching him great technique. It was mid-afternoon, so not too busy, but it was a great place to hang out and spend a couple of hours in Hue. Great price on drinks also!
Played a game of pool/billiards, had a coffee and a beer. They gave us a free cup of tea as well. Very chill vibes.
Good vibe, local gang put, beer and reasonably priced cocktails, served with enthusiasm. Pool table and good music. Worth a visit

name: Pinetree House Restaurant Huế
address: Cu Chanh 1, Thuy Bang, Hue, Vietnam, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description:
We were taken to this restaurant while on a tour with the Vietnam-based Legend tour company.  This place is a gem and the meal was one of the highlights of our tour.  First, we sat outdoors and the ambiance was brilliant.  The wait staff was so very attentive.  The food (we had a vegetarian lunch) included seven dishes including a vegetarian soup, mushrooms tempura,  wrapped tofu, salad and a flan desert all wonderfully tasty.  Other members of the group told us that the meat dishes were excellent.
       I ordered a coconut drink which was a coconut, straw and tiki umbrella.  Very retro and spot on!
     Do go here!

Excellent value and a great location to watch the world go by either on ground level or from the terraced bar. Would recommend.

I took a walking tour in Hue city and saw this one. Its near the walking street, in a corner of an intersection with an ideal location and spectacular view. The food was awesome that i had never tasted before. Everyone should try this one.

name: Banh Hue
address: 3 Pho Duc Chinh, Hue Vietnam
description:
Our dinner included several types of local cakes wrapped in banana leaves and was nicely filling. Total price was 120,000 đồng for 2 people.

The owner is very friendly and demonstrated how to eat each dish. She said (in Vietnamese, not English) her recipes had been passed down from an ancestor in the imperial palace staff!

This is a great place to visit if you'd like to sample some local specialties.

This place is a gem! It has a much more extensive menu than Hanh Restaurant- making it an easier place to return to for pescatarians. Very inexpensive too. The squid with lemon leaves blew my mind!

This is a local Hue restaurant with lovely staff (even though they do not speak English) and great food. Good spot to try local specialities! Plus side is defnitely the fact that we havent seen any tourists here!

name: Seaweed Food Restaurant
address: 5 Nhat Le Street, Hue Vietnam
description:
Very detailed and friendly owner.
Tasty food at reasonable price.
Fresh and delicous dishes with quite diversified drinks.
No msg is another reason I come back to Seaweed food so many times.
Highly recommend tapioca soup,tapioca starches with purple sweet potatos wrap in banana leaves.

name: B41 Restaurant
address: 40 Tran Cao Van Street, Hue Vietnam
description: The B41 bar is quite full with local people. You can relax and enjoy a few drinks in this cozy bar. The atmosphere is quite nice.

example_reviews: The B41 bar is quite full with local people. You can relax and enjoy a few drinks in this cozy bar. The atmosphere is quite nice.

Very happy with our choice of dishes. Food was tasty, fresh & filling. We ordered fried rice, chicken noodle, special tofu & spicy cabbage. Would definitely recommend. We like it spicy so ordered extra chilli on the side.

Young people having a great time around simmering hot pots. Ours was tasty, and spicy, but a little boring. Next time we'll stick with side dishes, and hell, maybe even pizza. Lots of unusual combinations to choose from. Then sit back on some of the most comfortable squat chairs we've sat on, enjoy the music, and everyone having a great evening.

name: Kim Restaurant
address: Võ Thị Sáu 24, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Coffee & Tea Burger Fastfood Delivery
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue

name: O Phụng bún bò Huế
address: 14 Nguyễn Du quán O Phụng, Hue Vietnam
description: Very good traditional Bun Bo Hue. The broth was a bit spicy but very nice. Really good value for price, one bowl ranged from 30-50k D. Place is not very attractive, but can highly recommend!
example_reviews: Very good traditional Bun Bo Hue. The broth was a bit spicy but very nice. Really good value for price, one bowl ranged from 30-50k D. Place is not very attractive, but can highly recommend!
Fantastic beef noodle soup. Their crab balls is a must try. Their broth-heavenly. You don’t know what you’re missing if you don’t try.

I came here with my family in the first day of 2021 and I feel it is good flavor and true traditional Hue beef noodles. They open only from 2pm to 6pm but many people come here for afternoon meal. For the full menu it is noodles with beef, fork, steam blood but You can use noodles with beef or fork. It is specal if you can use it with chili. The customer service is good and reasonable price. If you visit Hue and you want to try Traditional noodles you should go there

name: Nhuận An
address: 28/106 Nguyen Lo Trach street Xuan Phu District, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Take-away F&B service - We provide variety of coffee styles and other beverages served along with unique preparation processes. Besides, we offer fast-food and snack that are totally vegetarian (but you will not feel that it is) that will leverage your appetite. All you need to do is just sitting at where you are and making order, then you can relax, put on makeup, get ready to start the day and receive your food and drinks prepared by us. You can choose to pick-up at our court or get a home-delivery. Quầy đặt đồ ăn chay và thức uống ngon, chất lượng. Có hỗ trợ dịch vụ giao tận nơi nếu bạn không thể đến nhận đơn hàng tại quầy. Nhuận An hướng đến cung cấp trải nghiệm dịch vụ đặt món và lấy tại quầy tiết kiệm thời gian và chi phí. Thực đơn đồ ăn tại quầy hàng của Nhuận An hoàn toàn từ nguyên liệu chay và đảm bảo hương vị đậm đà, thơm ngon. Thức uống tại quán được pha chế từ nguyên liệu tự nhiên, chất lượng với công thức sáng tạo từ chuyên gia qua đào tạo Barista nhiều năm trong nghề.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: I ordered shipping to my home, the shop delivered very quickly and reliably. Milk tea and Milo are extremely easy to cook, the milk powder is rich, if you like sweet drinks, you should add more condensed milk 🤩 vegetarian bread is very suitable for my family's taste. Will definitely order food from this shop many times again 🥰

This is a takeaway vegan stall, with some special fast food that is suitable for all ages. I have tried "banh mi nuong" and "vegan pizza" here. It is very tasty. Also, you can try the combo with some fresh and clean drinks such as milk tea, fruit tea, and Vietnamese coffee.

I have eaten a lot of things here, and I think it is delicious, the food is clean, the staff is enthusiastic, and the price is affordable. There is also a staff who knows English, which is very convenient. There is a puppy that is so cute. If I have the opportunity, I will definitely come again. I will become a regular here.

description: We serve one of the best Italian coffee in town. If that isn't enough, we also have other drinks and cakes that match your taste. Enjoy your time in our cozy place!

example_reviews: Wonderful taste of hot and cold coffee. Spacious shop for sitting and taking sip of the coffee. Hot cocoa and non-dairy creamer add rich chocolaty goodness to this traditional Vietnamese drink made with condensed milk and strong coffee.
Stayed there to work on my laptop for few hours. Good service, great coffee, stable wifi. In my opinion, excellent place to chillout for a bit after having visited the Old Imperial City
Good coffee and service.good place to relax after visiting the imperia city. Also the smoothie are good.

name: An Tam
address: Kiet 33 Nguyen Cong Trur, Hue 52000 Vietnam
description:
We totally stumbled upon this absolute gem of a restaurant that is run by an absolute gem of a human!!!!

We have been 3 times and will go again tomorrow before our train.

He is passionate about sharing Hue cuisine and is taking English lessons so he can start teaching and sharing his family recipes with the world.

Today he invited us to a very special "off the menu" lunch feast. We tried delicacies he doesn't offer such as jellyfish!!!! A once in a lifetime experience and a real honour!

He also makes absolute divine happy water.....the best we've tasted anywhere in S.E. Asia!!!

His customers are both vietnamese tourists and foreigners alike!

address: Kiet 137 Truong Chinh Housenumber 22, Hue Vietnam
description: Saucy Hue. The best place in town for your chickenwing cravings! We have a wide range of worldwide sauces that are all homemade. From local home-fermented chilli sauces to Japanese Teriyaki and Dutch Joppie! On the side, we provide garden salads, rice and home-made french fries. To quench your thirst we have a wide range of drinks, going from Fresh fruit juices to soft drinks and cokctails. Come and enjoy!
example_reviews: This is a great spot for solo travelers or a small group. The wings were fantastic and just what I was looking for for a small break from Vietnamese food. The restaurant has a really cool dining area which is indoor/outdoor, and the staff are very kind. On top of the great food, the prices are very reasonable and probably even a little cheaper than the other non-Vietnamese food spots in town. Come check this place out in Hue!
Amazing wings and sauces. It really was delicious. Great atmosphere. Nice decor. Great service! Good prices. This was a great find and worth catching a ‘Grab’ to come and visit!

...really poor service. I've asked twice for fresh chili 🌶️ and still 10 minutes later you have to receive it. I just showed the waiter a picture of chili pepper - let's see if he gets it after a third time. Pizza is undercooked, there's definitely a severe lack of toppings on it. Well I got the chili but it's uncut. I guess I could do that myself with the butter knife. They don't use fresh dough here for the pizza, some kind of prefabricated bread disk that was previously frozen. I am so disappointed my dinner sucks. I only ate a couple pieces, I'm saving room so I can go someplace else and have something else.
Decided to have a quick drink but then also ordered pizza and fried banana cake. Delicious and low prices, pina colade mocktails for 25,000 that taste good. Got some free fruit afterwards. Top!

If you want to taste Hue traditional cakes or fresh noodle like banh loc, banh nam, bún bò ... it's not a good choice. This restaurant serves dishes for daily family lunch and dinner cooked in Hue recipes. Most of dishes are made from chicken, beef, pork and seafood. We ordered a basic Vietnamese lunch: a dish of stir-fried vegetable, roasted shrimp and pork, a bowl of sweet and sour bamboo soup and cooked rice. Really good taste! It was different from the same dishes' favour in the North and much better than in the South. I can't review its space because we chose a table on the terrace at the 1st floor where we could enjoy streets' view while eating. The price was reasonable, we (group of 3) paid around 200.000 dong for all.

Took a while to find the bar area in Hue and this was the first bar we came across. Good place to sit with a cold beer and see what is happening. Lots of locals were eating and the food looked to be okay but we decided that we wanted more of a restaurant type place to eat so had another beer and headed off.

OK to sit at the wooden tables on the footpath and have a well priced Tiger Crystal early on in the night but music gets too loud to be comfortable later on. Near impossible to get the attention of the young male staff who sit around smoking instead of serving customers. Currently busy later in the night when showing the World Cup. Mostly locals. Have not tried the food yet and probably won't from what I've seen. Just OK for a quick beer before moving on elsewhere.

name: King BBQ
address: th Floor, L04-07-08, 50A Hung Vuong Street Vincom Center Shopping Mall, Hue Vietnam
description:
Came here for dinner as not many Korean BBQ places were recommended by hotel in Hue. The staff were not good at explaining the menu or how they work like other restaurants I've experienced in Vietnam. We ended up spending 900k but for a very filling, rich meal with the fun of bbq own food. 
If you fancy trying something new with no idea what you'll end up eating then this is great. We had various meat, Oysters ( which did not look or taste fresh but ok) and various cold buffet items.

name: Cha Ca Ha Noi Ngu Pho
address: 1 Duong Van An, Hue 55000 Vietnam
description: Our restaurant introduces one of Hanoi speciality. Cha Ca (grilled fish) is a very typical dish of sophistication of Hanoi’s cuisine, using a variety of fresh Hemibagrus fish, spices and herbs resulting in amazing dish with fantastic flavours and unique taste combinations. Hanoi grilled turmeric fish with dill has been famous for over 100 years
cuisines: Japanese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Coming to Hue, you can still enjoy Hanoi cuisine, why not? I found a restaurant in Hue, the main dish here is Hanoi Fish Pattie. The restaurant is called Cha Ca Ngu Pho with a cozy design style that gives you an appetite when eating here. The restaurant staff was very enthusiastic, she assisted me in making food right at the table, it was professional. Fish cakes with green onions are very eye-catching, served with a sauce called shrimp paste and vermicelli. The taste is very good. I ordered a very frugal portion of fish porridge. Thank you Ngu Pho Fish Cha restaurant in Hue for giving me a wonderful experience when coming to Hue, a new dish!

name: Buncha House & Restaurant
address: 45 Bến Nghé Phú Hội, Hue 02343 Vietnam
description: BUN CHA (Bún chả) is a Vietnamese dish of grilled pork and noodle, which is thought to have originated from Hanoi, Vietnam. Bún chả is served with grilled fatty pork (chả) over a plate of white rice noodle (bún) and herbs with a side dish of dipping sauce. The dish was described in 1959 by Vietnamese food writer Vu Bang (1913–1984) who described Hanoi as a town “transfixed by bún chả.” Hanoi’s first bún chả restaurant was on Gia Ngư, Hoàn Kiếm District, in Hanoi’s Old Quarter. Bún chả originated and remains very popular in Hanoi. Outside Hanoi, across all regions of Vietnam, a similar dish of rice vermicelli and grilled meat called bún thịt nướng is alternately served. US President Obama and world-renowned culinary expert Anthony Bourdain have enjoyed this dish on the time they in Vietnam The fist time in Hue city, Vietnam had a restaurant inside BUNCHA HOUSE, have “BUN CHA – NEM RAN” (Bún chả – Nem Rán) to server you. We would like to comment all of customer come to Hue city, VN
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: Enjoyed a noodle dish with mixed vegetables- very tasty. This along with a local beer and a bottle of water for about $3! Very pleasant dining room with a nice breeze cooling things off. Recommended for a good meal at low cost.
we stayed accommodation here two nights and try they food for lunch and dinner. special food " Bun Cha - nem ran" verry verry fanatics.

example_reviews: Nice view, everyone here so friendly and great beverage. Price is not too expensive. The shop just opening a few months, but service is not bad. Generally, I feel comfortable when I come here

name: Restaurant Bun Bo Thuong Tu
address: 8 Dinh Tien Hoang Street, Hue Vietnam
description: The food is delicious and the prices are right! Chicken, veggies and steamed rice for 70,000 vnd. Spring rolls for 40,000 vnd. Ice tea for 5,000 vnd. The tea is homemade, cold, and unsweetened. There are fans and higher chairs and metal tables. Comfortable street food. Over all we spent three weeks in Hue and are here multiple times even though it was across the bridge from where we were. It was worth the walk. Plus the entrance to the citadel is up the road if the old city is on the list of things to do.

A family run gem near the citadel gate entrance. The prices are right. 5000 vnd for a cold ice tea. #42 is chicken with steamed rice and veggies for 70000 vnd. Also tried spring rolls for 40000 vnd. All delicious! The veggie plate is a mixture of carrot, cabbage, onion, tomato, string beans, bamboo shoots and a tasty sauce. They even have homemade chili sauce for those spicy folks out there. Over our three week stint in Hue we ate multiple times here. Highly recommend!

We had a delicious lunch of bun bo hue, banh beo, and bun chay after touring the imperial city, the menu has many seafood and vegetarian options in addition to the meat focused items. We were also able to get our banh beo with just the shrimp and no pork. If you want a sit down restaurant and not just a stool near the palace this is a great option.

example_reviews: I was looking for somewhere to eat and i saw this restaurant in the street. I decided to stop there . I took one mojito cocktail , it was really really good . After that I ordered some beef for the bbq . The waiter kindly cooked it for me when he saw that I didn’t really know what to do . After that one waitress saw that I didn’t really know how to eat it so she showed me how to do it . The beef was so yummy, I still don’t believe how tasty it was . Even not everyone in the restaurant was speaking English I could see that they really did their best for trying to understand and communicate with me , I totally appreciate it . Everyone was smiling, looks like everyone enjoying working here .I wish in every restaurant in the world people would be looks this happy . Besides, the restaurant also has nutritious and refreshing drinks. WAGYU YO KOREAN BBQ RESTAURANT WELCOME!
example_reviews: I was looking for somewhere to eat and i saw this restaurant in the street. I decided to stop there . I took one mojito cocktail , it was really really good . After that I ordered some beef for the bbq . The waiter kindly cooked it for me when he saw that I didn’t really know what to do . After that one waitress saw that I didn’t really know how to eat it so she showed me how to do it . The beef was so yummy, I still don’t believe how tasty it was . Even not everyone in the restaurant was speaking English I could see that they really did their best for trying to understand and communicate with me , I totally appreciate it . Everyone was smiling, looks like everyone enjoying working here .I wish in every restaurant in the world people would be looks this happy . It’s a good place for eating with you family , couple or even alone. I totally recommend this restaurant

Cute restaurant. Gave me a bowl of pho with egg and beef balls, But I ordered vegetarian fried noodles. I still ate it since I was too hungry to wait for a corrected dish (I'm not vegetarian anyway), and it did taste really good. They also put salt in my orange juice instead of sugar, but they happily rectified it. The food is good, the service friendly however very inconsistent. I'm not sure if it was a language barrier, new nervous staff, or just a bad day for the waitress, but I would happily visit them for another go in the future :)

name: Khong Gian Xua
address: 76 Le Loi, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: Khong Gian Xua Restaurant system consists of 3 facilities in Hue City with very close spaces. Serving more than 300 delicious and fresh dishes, Khong Gian Xua Restaurant system continues to exploit the culinary treasure of Hue by adding the traditional, unique and novel flavors with extreme flavors of an ancient capital to the menu.
cuisines: Italian Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: This restaurant was highly recommended both by our guide and the hotel concierge. The restaurant has two locations in Hue. We ended up going to the one in 79 Le Loi st. A disappointment. First off, they said they had AC. Alltough technically correct (there was a split unit on the wall), they didn’t want to turn it on and they brought as a fan. Then came the ordering… We first ordered drinks: Beers for the adults and fantas and water for the young. After 10 minutes they only brought the beers and they told us that they didn’t have fanta and that they had ran out of bottled water… I ended up telling them to go to a store to buy water (which they did, warm water). We ordered plenty of dishes and each time the waiter said they were very good dishes. Some of them came with different ingredients (which they recognised only when yountold them) and some others they ended up saying after a while that they did not habe that dish. Truly a dissappointment. I just hope the original khong gian xua is better than this one. We’ll not go to try it though….

We enjoyed our dinner very much at this restaurant! The manager is very kind and he spoke perfectly English. He helped us to choose the right food as we have to eliminate sugar from our diet! Wonderfully decorated dishes and very tasty food. A lovely small restaurant.
This restaurant has bad food and bad service. Too expensive and they trick customers into ordering 1 and getting 2 (see pic). Never come back

name: Sen Restaurant
description:
Amazing food, you can pick what you want to eat from the large tanks filled with clams, shrimps, fish, crabs, and so on.
The food is cooked rather fast. A large selection of beverages is also available. 
Bottom line, some of the best seafood I've ever tasted, and on top of it all, is as fresh as you can get.
Biggest plus is that you eat watching the sea and listening to waves crash on the golden sand.
Prices are not to high, but not the lowest I've seen in Vietnam(even if only locals eat here).

name: WHITE Garden Cafe
address: 18 Nguyen Hue, Hue 084121 Vietnam
description: A cappuccino (Listeni/ˌkæpᵿˈtʃiːnoʊ/; Italian: [kapuˈtʃiːno]) is an Italian coffee drink that is traditionally prepared with espresso, hot milk and steamed milk foam. Cream may be used instead of milk and is often topped with cinnamon.[1] It is typically smaller in volume than a caffe latte, with a thicker layer of micro foam. The name comes from the Capuchin friars, referring to the colour
example_reviews: This is a nice cafe and a welcome stop during or visit of downtown Hue. Excellent coffee, with light snacks available.

A nice shady cafe with a cool breeze. My husband managed to get a long black coffee and watermelon seeds to break open and eat. I am vegan and ordered a watermelon juice (no sugar). My daughter ordered NZ ice cream and my son a cookies and cream shake which was blended and made beautifully. Service was very good, but english is not so good. Pictures and hand gesters worked fine. To get out of trouble and kill your appetite it was good, the place was clean and good service. They didn't take long to bring the food.

name: Mee - O
address: 18b Ngo Gia Tu, Phuong Vinh Ninh, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: welcome to Banh my chao Mee - O! we have fried eggs with beaf,Pho ga,pho Bo,spaghetti,fried noodles with seafood...coffee and juice.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: This is one of many local restaurants in Hue, regardless, the mi chao op la they serve here is beyond delicious. The platter is well seasoned, every ingredient is fresh and full of flavour. The meat tender, banh mi is crisp and fresh, everything just perfectly complements each other. The sauce is a little on the salty side, but for the Hue sun where you lose a substantial amount of salt by sweating, it’s not too terrible. The owner does not speak much English, but it wasn’t too much of a bother. Just ask for the mi chao op la and you’ll be on your merry way to a comfortable meal. The entrance has 2 steps, but there’s a patio and the staff is eager to lend a hand if the need arises. Overall, a great place for breakfast.

name: The Hub Beer - Lounge - Restaurant
address: 8 Hung Vuong Street, Hue Vietnam
description: The hub is the premier venue for great foods, beer and nightlife in Hue city. It is located in the center area of Hue city on Hung Vuong street, about 200 meters (0.1 mile) from the popular tourist spot, Truong Tien bridge. We offer a large variety of hand-crafted cocktails, local and imported draft and bottled beers. We have live DJ music every night of the week. Come and enjoy.
cuisines: Chinese Restaurants for Lunch in Hue
example_reviews: This is so weird as I'm still in this place finishing my beer after not being able to finish my meal - I honestly could not chew it. I'm actually having a giggle as it's my own fault-first night in Hue, not sure of my surroundings!! Stopped at the 1st open air place closest to where I was staying. I was the only customer with 5 or 6 staff and the lovely waitress tried to take my order but spoke no English. I tried to use google translate but it was a bit frustrating. I've never reviewed a place while I'm still at it! To cut a long story short, before I even got my food, my table had been wiped 4 times, sort of like each time I took a sip of my drink. The food was simply the worst meal I have been served in my life! I attempted to chew a calamari ring with no success. You should be able to see it on the plate in the photo. 'Tough as boot leather' comes nowhere near describing this food. Can't wait to experience some of the delicious offerings that Hue has to offer. The staff were hovering around to an uncomfortable extent and I eventually asked the to give me some space. I'm just about to give them some- forever!

description: The King's Panorama Bar is a great place to have a sundowner and watch the sunset over the Perfume River. The place is a good place to unwind and have drinks with friends or family. The drinks are well priced and the snack food are good too. Highly recommend this place.

example_reviews: The King's Panorama Bar is a great place to have a sundowner and watch the sunset over the Perfume River. The place is a good place to unwind and have drinks with friends or family. The drinks are well priced and the snack food are good too. Highly recommend this place.

Ok, a re-created Royal Banquet at the Imperial Court could be a little bit hokey if you aren't into it, but...if you let your imagination take over, you can have a really good time at this place. And who knows, you might be selected to wear Imperial Yellow - and impersonate the Emperor or Empress. Once you enter from the street, you are in a small courtyard where staff helps you to select a costume fit for an Imperial Banquet. Most are silk embroidered tunics with matching headdresses and, quite frankly, if you are with friends, it's a photo op. Everybody lines up and forms a procession into the dining room, and once seated, a group of musicians and singers takes over. As I understood, the entertainers are students who are studying traditional instruments and musical technique. They sell a very nice CD of their work; I listened to it a couple of times now and enjoy it. The same CD is on sale at the Imperial Palace. The food isn't bad. Course after course of traditional foods are brought to the table, each dish luxuriously garnished with vegetables carved into fanciful shapes. One dish has a pair of carp cut form carrots; another has a dragon made from another vegetable; another is garnished with kissing doves. There were ten courses in all and I particularly liked the lotus seed soup and the steamed fish with onions and vegetables. If you close your eyes for a minute and just think of how it might have been at court, it works. Relax, settle into the mood, and take a walk on the wild side. You'll be surprised how much fun it is.
We had the green mango salad fantastic, the soup also terrific , the fried calamari a bit western and common. Met the owner a wonderful interesting entrepreneur

example_reviews: My friend told me should enjoy PHO when came to Vietnam. It's traditional food in vietnam. I have a good dinner here, everything is ok but it seem that the price is not fair. It seem that the foreigners must pay more than the local.
We did eat pho here many times before when were students at uni. After 10 years, came back, they changed address to Ba Trieu ate, however the pho is not as nice as before. A bit disappointed

If u don't mind seeing the owner walk past with a handful of noodles for your dish to be cooked out the back then you are set. Although we were a little sceptical at first, we ate here and never got ill. It was authentic and full of flavour and the owners were lovely. We had pork in flour soup which was fried wontons on the side of a soup with veggies and beef fried noodles which were the best I've had in Vietnam. We also got a noodle soup which had some great flavour! It's certainly not fancy but if you want local and flavour with a smile, go here!

name: Chimaek
address: 37 Alley 64 Nguyen Cong Tru Phu Hoi Ward, Hue 530000 Vietnam
description: An authentic Korean fried chicken restaurant which has over 8 glazing sauces to choose, from the classic Yangnyeom/Dakgangjeong (sweet&spicy/soy sauce) to the internatinal inspirations like buttermilk or teriyaki karaage. We also have a variety side menu: Tteobokki(spicy rice cake), Bibimbap(mixed rice bowl), Gimbap(rice roll), Donkkaseu(pork cutlet), Tangsuyuk(scrispy pork with sweet&sour sauce),

example_reviews: Two of us came here for the first time in Oct 8th. I tried a Teriyaki fried chicken, a Tokbokki and fried chicken rice with sweet and sour sauce. I seemed small but we were too full after the meal. The taste is super duper good. Not too salty, not too sweet, it is perfect. The spicies matched perfectly with each other. I was so impressed and surprised!!!!!!!!!!! But the most amazing part isn’t that. When I paid for the whole meal, the price didn’t high. Compare the price with the quality I didn’t believe that it can be that cheap. OMG!!!! Highly recommend for those who have a chance to come to Hue. You must’ve tried the food in this small and cozy Korean chicken restaurant!!! Obviously I will come back whenever I go back to Hue.

name: Bangkok restaurant
address: 92 Le Viet Luong street, An Dong ward, Hue Vietnam
description: We are only Thai Restaurant in Hue , original Thai's chef and owner from Thailand. We have variety of authentic Thai's food with great atmosphere. You can come to enjoy lunch or dinner here. Location is not far from Big-C Supermarket in town. Please take a chance to visit us or call us for make a reservation. We are always welcome you.
example_reviews: After a diet of vietnam food for the past few weeks it was a delight to find this thai restaurant in Hue Although the menu is not in english, the manager took great delight in helping us to choose from an array of Thai food. All staff very friendly and food exceptional. A lively and enegetic place and seems very popular with the young local people. May be a little noisey for some but if you want good Thai food at reasonable prices this is the place to go.

Bangkok restaurant is located on a quiet back street five minutes from the tourist center. It is a family run restaurant and the owner is very friendly and speaks some English. He loves Thai culture and Thai food and one of his family members is from Thailand. He shared several tips with us about sights to see in Hue. We came with an appetite to conquer and sampled many items on the menu. The chicken and egg pad thai was exquisite. The noodles were not overcooked and the dish had just the right amount of spice to give it that essential kick. Unlike Pad Thai in the west it was not too sweet. The tofu dish was excellent and tasted even better than it looked on the menu. We also had the seafood noodle dish and it was spicy with lots of Thai seasonings. All of the portions are generous and you will not leave this restaurant hungry. We will definitely revisit Bangkok restaurant again in the future.

The food here is good and the Thai chef does a great job. The remodel of this restaurant was for the worse. It was so much better when it was open air. It is unreasonably loud to the point that you can't hear the person across from you talking. It has the acoustics of a tin shed, because that's what it is. After coming in early in the day to reserve a table for dinner for a large group, we were assured that we would get a "special" table. We didn't. I asked them in advance to chill a case of beer. They didn't. When we asked for cold beer we got warm beer. Every table in the restaurant was screaming "mot, hai, ba, yo" and throwing beer cans on the floor. Yeah it's Vietnam and that's normal behavior, I get it, but this place took it to another level. At the table next to us, one guy was passed out laying across the bench seat, with legs and arms dangling on the floor, onto which his dining companion was vomiting. I wouldn't normally blame a restaurant for the behavior of customers but this seemed to be what the owners and management have created, a Vietnamese beer hall full of screaming, red-faced drunks, that happens to have pad Thai noodles and satay. We left after getting appetizers though the fifteen of us planned on staying for dinner but couldn't handle the "ambience." While it wasn't for us, they seem to be doing fine for business. The place was absolutely packed. It's a shame too because the food is good. I won't be back, maybe take out next time.

name: King Beer
address: 35A Tran Van Ky, Hue Vietnam
description: I recently took a trip to Hue, Vietnam and was strolling around with some friends and stumbled upon King Beer. It's a big restaurant with AMAZING food. Ideal for the night life vibe as seen with a couple of groups sitting around, eating and drinking in the restaurant. Good selection of Vietnamese beer, authentic food (ideally for drinking, not so much family style) along with free wifi, clean restrooms and clean vicinities. Highly recommend the clams steamed with garlic, super good! Only *rough* downside is English is very limited here, but Google Translate to the rescue! MUST GO!
